Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: 4cents-worth
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion in town with over 13 people and we all stayed at the Silver Cloud at .Lake Union. It was very comfortable, clean, and reasonably priced. The breakfast was very extensive and quite good. The bed was comfortable, and it had a real blanket instead of the down comforter, which I find too hot. Sink outside of the bathroom was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: mimbles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn for the third time on South Lake Union in Seattle. Lucky enough to have received great rates on priceline twice. The hotel is immaculate, the rooms are very spacious, the decor pleasing and some have lake views. The real plus is that this hotel has free parking( a rare thing in Seattle)....a shuttle that will take you where you want to go and Seattle's light rail (all two miles of it) is located a few blocks away and will get you downtown. Add to this a really nice breakfast room with lake views and a lot of breakfast options. All of this topped off by extremely kind and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Eric A
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night. My wife and I had an appointment nearby and we were taking the Victoria Clipper the next day and so we stayed at this hotel. Absolutely no regrets. As soon as we checked in we left our bags in the room and went back downstairs to take the free shuttle to Pike Place Market. The shuttle also goes to Pioneer Square and the Space Needle. When we called to be picked up again, the shuttle was back at the drop off point in less than 10 minutes. The room was clean and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for one night...”
Reviews.Author: brian s
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silver Cloud for one night last week. I flew up to see my daughter who was attending Seattle University. You can't get a better location if you have a child attending SU. It is right across the street. I took the light rail from Seatac to the last stop, Westlake, which is DT Seattle. I called the hotel and a van was dispatched which picked me up at the Sephora, a block from the station. I only waited about ten minutes for the van. Check-in went quickly and smoothly. I stayed in a third floor room. It was small but had every comfort I needed. Fridge, microwave, coffee maker, wireless, etc. I didn't have time to use any of the facilities. I did enjoy "Happy hour" at Jimmy's, the bar/restaurant that co-joins the hotel. They have a regular happy hour and an evening one. The happy hour menu is rather varied with decent prices. If you sit at the bar and look out onto Broadway, the view is disorienting in a fun way. From the bar, Jimmy's appears to be located below street level. So the view of street traffic suggests that a car could plow into the window. If you go, you will see what I mean. Overall, a fine experience. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best for Lake View and New Year Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: LesbeAsian
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for New Year's Eve 2012 and it was the best deal. Most properties charge quite a bit to stay during this holiday and especially for a view of the annual fireworks show. This hotel however offered the greatest view of both the lake and fireworks for a great price. The room had a small/baby size deck where we could comfortably enjoy the view from our room. The decor and comfort level of the room itself is just okay - fairly standard and unappealing in our opinion. The value though is great. There is a pretty good continental breakfast included with the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money !!”
Reviews.Author: DPZ44
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed for the weekend and were very impressed. The staff are very helpful and friendly. We stayed in a jacuzzi suite and everything in the room functioned as it should. We travel quite a bit and that is hard to find!! If we ever travel to Seattle again we will definitely stay at the silver cloud. I can't say there is one thing I can complain about...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rhumbagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night to see the Gauguin show at the Museum. Great hotel, easy to find, just off the I-5. Our room wasn't ready so we took their shuttle downtown to see the Gauguin show and wander Pike Place Market. We also went to the Seattle Public Library to see the interesting architecture. One phone call and the shuttle picked us up where we were dropped off and we were settled into a nice room. The breakfast was good, eggs and sausages, waffles along with the usual pastries, fruit and yogurt. The coffee is pretty good, too. The best part is the free parking in a secured lot. No problems at all. We had dinner at Joey's across the way, you can walk over, it was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud”
Reviews.Author: Dteacher60
Reviews.Content: How could we have missed this jewel of a place to stay in Seattle? In the past we have stayed in the downtown Seattle area, dodging the traffic, paying for tight parking; but Lake Union's Silver Cloud was tucked away close to downtown with FREE, secured parking and gorgeous views. We all loved the FANTASTIC work-out equipment and great morning breakfast! Room was comfortable and well-decorated. We definitely will stay here again on the next trip to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Top choice”
Reviews.Author: caasiBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011 and really enjoyed it. We had a room with a view of the lake and our boys enjoyed watching the sea planes take off and land. It was also lovely in the evening to watch the lights coming on around the city. The room was large enough to take the four of us, two adults, two teenage sized boys and all the stuff we travelled with for six weeks on the road. Breakfast was plentiful, the pool warm and one thing I loved, the washer and dryer were complimentary. They have a shuttle that can take you into the city centre and pick you up but we found we could walk to distance or take the tram, which stops just down the road. This was a great place to stay and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: dad2spam
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, nice rooms, great breakfast, free secured parking, We stayed here before and are booked to stay again in March.

Reviews.Title: “There when we really needed them”
Reviews.Author: JaneQSmith
Reviews.Content: I got caught in the huge Seattle snow storm of January 2012. The town basically shut down for 2 days. I must say that the staff continued to keep in great spirits, and guided us through the challenges of city transportation when everything was on unpredictable snow schedules. Every staff member treated us so kindly, even when we got lost and couldn't find a bus late at night. I will definitely stay at this lovely hotel again. When it cleared up, the view was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in town!”
Reviews.Author: FisherGirl88
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here and both times I have been extremely happy. The staff is very friendly and happy to serve. I got in town sooner than planned and even though it was only 11:30 am the staff graciously let me move in! The breakfast in the morning is a bonus too as it stays open til 10 on weekends and 9:30 weekdays...which in my experience is rare. Love this place! The rooms are very well stocked and even though it is close to the freeway you never hear it. Lots of extra pillows too..slept great. I should mention here they have a shuttle service and they will take you and pick you up....no parking hassles!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this delightful Hotel. Who provide wonderful stay, friendly service and an extraordinary breakfast. The room was beautiful, sunny and clean, and we were made to feel at home at all times. It’s a breath of fresh air because of the stunning landscape outside with beautiful flowers. Overall, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extended stay in January”
Reviews.Author: vintagemary67
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Silver Cloud a few times because of its convenient location near our children's home, AND because it offers the things we consider to be luxuries: easy and free parking, a nice hot breakfast each morning, comfortable and clean rooms with micros and frigs, and a professional and helpful staff. This is a well-run property with good people in charge. You can easily walk from here to the Seattle Wooden Boat Museum and around other marinas. And they have a shuttle that takes you to the Space Needle, Pike Place market and Pioneer Square. There is also a pool on the lobby level, and a very nice fitness facility. Joey's restaurant a couple blocks south is good, moderately priced. Chandler's Crab House is more expensive, but nice, and Daniel's Broiler (steaks) is more of a business-dinner kind of place. Unfortunately, the BluWater Bistro and, we are told, Hooters, are out of business. There is also Duke's Chowderhouse, which we haven't been to.

Reviews.Title: “Poor cleanliness and front desk- otherwise great”
Reviews.Author: revsal
Reviews.Content: The previous occupants of our room ate fresh fruit, and the carpet was full of seeds, etc. It had not been vacuumed before our arrival. In spite of our request to the front desk, the floor remained untouched when we arrived back the 2nd evening after a day out. A second request finally got the floor cleaned. The tub was full of hairs- not our own- but I rinsed it out myself. I can only hope sheets and towels were clean. Fire alarm early Monday morning rousted all of the occupants, but front desk personnel offered no guidance, insight, or assistance. Breakfast, location, and availability of shuttle were great, but this hotel has got to work on the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: claire542
Reviews.Content: This is a real favorite!! We go to Seattle a few times a year to visit our daughter and family and it would be hard to get us to stay anywhere else. We always reserve a suite with a balcony and sometimes a corner room which is even better. The view is terrific and the service superb. This year we were there for Christmas and asked if it would be o.k. to send out Christmas packages in advance. No Problem! When we arrived the Desk Clerk told us we were staying in her FAVORITE room and from there on in we felt welcome and appreciated. The Town Car offers free shuttle service to downtown; they've upgraded the free Continental Breakfast; the exercise room is convenient and adequate; the nearby restaurants are up and running again and the value can't be beat. A little bar or restaurant would be great but overall this hotel definitely fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Super Convenient, Free Parking & Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: HLSTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights to go to a Seahawks game and explore Seattle. We were very happy with our choice. The FREE shuttle service was fantastic. It leaves the hotel on the hour and half hour and you call up the hotel to ask to be picked up when you're ready. We were able to take the shuttle to the stadium on game day which was incredibly convenient. It was about a 5-10 minute ride from the hotel to downtown. Our room overlooked Lake Union and had a view of the space needle. It was comfortable and new. We didn't have any complaints about the heat, water, etc. Breakfast was standard but a nice spread for a free breakfast. The free parking was a nice plus as well. There were a few restaurants across the street overlooking the lake. We tried Joey's and enjoyed it - it was crowded on a Friday night but we didn't have to wait. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room”
Reviews.Author: Dransom
Reviews.Content: The location across from Lake Union is perfect! The rooms were clean, good size and comfy for the price point. The customer service was awesome as well. The offer free shuttle service to a few locations in downtown Seattle which is really convenient. The shuttle driver, John was so accomodating with great customer service. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: cyberbelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights, two rooms. Rooms were very nice, the staff was very helpful and professional, the breakfast was ok. Still prefer the breakfast at Hampton Inn. The exercise room is excellent and opened 24 hours. Didn't use the spa or pool. Did use the elevator accessed from the garage and it is very quick, as opposed to the one near the lobby, which is used by more people. Really liked the atmosphere of this hotel and plan to stay there again in a few months. We had a car so didn't use the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Good all the way around...”
Reviews.Author: breezy41
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights while visiting with family. Loved the location; can get to downtown attractions via trolley (end of the line is 2 blocks from the hotel), yet not as congested as being in the heart of downtown. Besides that, the shuttle driver(s) are VERY accomodating - pleasant, and will veer off the scheduled stops to customize what you need if they can swing it. Even offered to take our whole family to whatever dinner spot we picked, even tho' they weren't all staying at the hotel! Rooms are very comfortable and clean and ours was very good sized - we even had a fireplace! Even tho' they do not have a bar or restaurant, there are several nice places within walking distance on beautiful Lake Union. The complimentary breakfast was one of the better ones we've had - along with the standard waffle, cereal, and pastries, they also had scrambled eggs, sausage and canadian bacon - everything was warm and tasty! Will probably be our go-to place next time we go to Seattle to see the family!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FandM_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded out expectation. From the moment we checked in we had good vibes. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. Location of the hotel was beautiful but a little way out of the city, but they provided a shuttle to 3 different locations in the city. The breakfast was very nice as was the room. They also had free parking which was a relief as we parked our car and never went back to it until we were leaving. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected ...”
Reviews.Author: Kim H
Reviews.Content: What an unexpected treat! We arrived early evening and were greeting cheerfully and efficiently by the staff at the desk. Our (myself, my daughter and my granddaughter) reason for staying was for my granddaughter's surgery the following morning at Children's Hospital. We wanted her to have an opportunity to swim and play as well as be sure we would be at the hospital on time the following morning. We were booked in a double queen room without a view and the young man at the desk kindly upgraded us to a view room since the hotel was not full. My granddaughter loved watching the sea planes and the space needle! The pool area was clean (although the pool was a bit cool) and we all enjoyed playing for a couple of hours and then soaking in the hot tub. The room was clean and well appointed and we especially appreciated the second sink area when getting ready the following morning. When my daughter went to the desk to see if there was a cork screw available to borrow, she was given a complimentary one to take home. We appreciated the opportunity for express check out in the morning as we had an early departure and it was one less thing to do. Overall, this was a very positive stay and I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and plan to return with my husband for a more relaxing visit in the future. The breakfast wasn't available when we departed (too early) but the room looked lovely and I am sure it would have been good. What makes this hotel stand out is the staff. We didn't run into anyone that wasn't cheerful and devoted to making our stay the best it could be. As many of you travelers know, this is not the 'norm' these days. The hiring and training practices at this hotel must be exceptional and it didn't go unnoticed.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1615
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was "really great"! We were there for our anniversary and I cannot say enough about our experience. The hotel room, staff, and breakfast were wonderful. The free shuttle to desirable Seattle downtown locations and the free parking were both a fantastic plus. We were able to secure a nice rate discount on the internet. Highly recommend this hotel for couples traveling to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: JohnsonsinDallas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn and loved it! The staff was super nice, gave us great recommendations and we used the shuttle service a lot. We did all the tourist attractions and ate at some great places. The hotel itself has a business center with new computers and printers that really helped out to print coupons, maps, and boarding passes. The breakfast is great with a good selection of hot and cold items. Will stay here again next time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: Magna99
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Silver Cloud Inn - Lake Union was near perfect. The room was plenty large enough, spotlessly clean, and nicely furnished. The shower had great water pressure and the Aveda bath products were great. The rate included free, secure parking, free wi-fi, free newspaper, and free hot breakfast which included scrambled eggs, waffles, sausage and ham. And by the way, it was quite tasty. The free shuttle service to downtown was a very nice benefit, too. We will absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: JJTravelGal
Reviews.Content: Silver Cloud Lake Union hotel has 7 floors in a quiet area that caters to families and business travelers. Silver Cloud offers good rates clean rooms and lots of amenities. Overall great value! And there's 2 other locations in Seattle. Stayed here in mid-July 2011; rate for 2 queen beds was $169 per night before taxes. Hotel stay includes: - gated covered parking; space is a little tight in some spots if you drive a large car - in room free wifi with good connection for you tube videos - breakfast goes beyond typical continental as there's make your own waffles, scrambled eggs, sausages, muffins, fresh fruit (though this one goes fast in the morning), cereal, oatmeal, toast, English muffins, juice and coffee - shuttle bus to three locations (space needle, pike place market and pioneer square). Pretty much pick up and drop off are almost every 30 mins depending on how busy they are and traffic - paper in the morning (Seattle Time) - coffee and tea available all the time - Aveda bath products - free use of business centre with two desk top computers and printers Other nice things: microwave and fridge in the room. Washer and dryer available for guests to do their own laundry. Service was friendly from front desk staff to shuttle drivers. Separate and additional sink outside of the bathroom. Small issues: - elevators are pretty slow - one main one in the lobby and two on the south side but connects to the garage so you have to walk through garage area for about 5 meters - coffee machine is in the bathroom - very odd location to have coffee aroma wafting out of the bathroom - bathroom is small as door just clears toilet by an inch but nice that another sink and mirror is located outside of bathroom - probably one of the weaker hair dryers that I've ever used; I have thick hair so it took forever to blow dry it - hotel is definitely older but you can tell they renovated the place several years ago so things don't feel too old

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with all you need”
Reviews.Author: GoBeavs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend when attending a football game at Century Link Field. I was a little concerned that it might be far away but the free shuttle service made it extremely easy to get around and actually ran later than normal to accommodate the football fans. The pool was great for the kids and is open 24 hours. The free breakfast had a little bit of everything for everyone...although crowded both times we ate there, the food was replenished quickly. There is a little store easy 10 min. or less walk away if you wanted to pick up snacks,wine, beer, etc. The beds and rooms were comfortable and had a mini fridge. Parking was free which is also another big perk!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice property, well priced and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: NZTravelExpert
Reviews.Content: I stayed again at the Silver Cloud Inn Lake Union for a 3 night stay over a weekend. Once again I found the rooms to be of a good standard, staff friendly helpful and attentive. Whilst the property is not "downtown/CBD" the property operates a regular shuttle service to and from the central city area (takes about 8 mins) and the street tram terminal is just 4 mins walk. Just be aware that the property only offers a breakfast room eg no bar or restaurant for evening dining. (given the proximity to the lake and the views , I think it's a shame that they don't). Having said that there are a good number of restaurant choices within a 6/8 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great, We liked it”
Reviews.Author: Jacki R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was friendly. We had no problems whatsoever. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, price, rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: Nade70
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn October 21-23, 2011. Check-in was a breeze with free parking. Rooms are spacious, modern and clean. Beds are wonderful. Room has mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Stayed in double queen room, no view, but the view of the street was not bad at all. Other friends stayed in view room with view of Space Needle, great room as well. Bathroom is a bit on the small side, but nothing to complain about. Free breakfast included, area very crowded, but we were there for college football game at CenturyLink, so very busy weekend. Breakfast choices were adequate. Pool is open 24 hours which was great for the kids and the pool area is well taken care of. They offer free shuttle service to downtown area; excellent service, ran every 15 minutes, just sign up. Pick-up was a breeze and the 2 drivers we encountered were awesome! Will definately go back to the Silver Cloud when we are in Seattle again!

Reviews.Title: “Tuesday night is really wonderful”
Reviews.Author: nancyandbob_10
Reviews.Content: The shuttle service is a really great feature, parking is free and really secure, and the reception on Tuesday night was very fun--good food, wine and beer and live music. Shuttle leaves every half hour and pick up time is accurate. Traveled with son and daughter in law and booked a suite with view. There are dishes and utensils, daily cleaning--this is a great place to stay if you want to eat dinner in, have breakfast free and stay in a really clean, nice place. We paid for the suite with a view and it is nice, water during the day and lights at night, but don't know that it is essential. Union Lake is not a walkable lake, no trails or hikes, it is a working lake with boats,planes, and wharves, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Silver Cloud!”
Reviews.Author: JennandRob
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for a long weekend during a beautiful sun-filled weekend in Oct 2011. We stayed in a king Suite with View, and the room exceeded all our expectations! The bedroom had enough room for a portable crib, and mom was able to enjoy some privacy in the other room with pocket doors! It was more than enough space, complete with a view of lake Union and the Space Needle. Breakfast was served daily, and although delicious, it's the same thing everyday. The complimentary shuttle was awesome and super convenient. The shuttle can bring you to three main attractions: Pioneer Square, Pike market and the Space Needle---as well as restaurants along the way. We never waited longer than 15mins for the next shuttle to whisk us around Seattle. The drivers were all friendly and courteous, and even made restaurant suggestions and reservations. If you have a car, the free parking is a huge plus---and very hard to come by. However, if you drive downtown, expect to pay $4/hr to leave the car.......so take the shuttle instead! All in all, it was a great value, clean and convenient! I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The best stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Carlose1951
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Seattle Silver Cloud ( Union Lake) in August 2011 was one of most pleasant stay in Seattle,plus the excellent transportation in the form of a mini bus was provided for guests staying at this wonderful hotel. The service was friendly and efficient. Our room was 501 clean, comfortable, well furnished and the jacussi perfect. A short distance to downtown . Free internet with printer readily available. The breakfast buffet was excellent include with the room. I would happily give this fine hotel a 10 and will certainly return. I will recommend this hotel to my friends and family. We will certainly come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline07_69
Reviews.Content: We spent here the first two nights because we started from Seattle with our round trip in the Northwest of USA and we liked it so much that we also spent our last two nights before flying back home (first time kingsize de luxe, second time two queen view). A beautiful view of Lake Union (and Space Needle) from our room, great to see the waterplanes land and go up again. Both times we had a spacious room with a flatscreen tv, good matresses and a nice bathroom, all very clean. Staff was very friendly, the have a shuttle service that brings you to Seattle center or downtown, so you can leave the car in the free (!) parking lot of the hotel (although you can walk it, about 30 minutes to Space Needle, but shuttle service is complimentary). Great breakfast with varieties of food, like toast, waffles, scrambled eggs, muffins, yoghurt, fruit. When we go back to Seattle area we certainly will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: GED450
Reviews.Content: Having spent 21 day's travelling north to south ( Seattle to San- Diego) this hotel/motel was without a doubt the best value for money it's clean tidy staff are fantastically friendly & helpful what's more free parking which is a big bonus as some of the other hotels/motel are charging up to $30.00 a night & you get the even bigger bonus of a free shuttle bus taking you to all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Silver Cloud”
Reviews.Author: jancooke
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Seattle Silver Cloud in June 2011was most pleasant. A little way out of the city but transport in the form of a mini bus was provided for guests staying at this wonderful hotel. The service was friendly and efficient. Our room was clean, comfortable and well furnished. A tram running a regular service down town was a short 5 minute walk away or the hotel mini bus running every 30mins. Free internet with printer readily available. The breakfast was excellent and daily tariff reasonable. I would happily give this fine hotel 7/10 and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Ned07666
Reviews.Content: Our room was generously sized, clean and comfortable. The included continental breakfast was quite good. It was actually an expanded continental breakfast buffet with scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles, muffins, bagels, cold cereal, and yoghurt as well as juice and coffee/decaf and it was served in an attractive lounge. Secure on-site parking was also included as was wi-fi and the use of a "business center" with computer and printer. This property is competitive with Marriott's Residence Inn hotels and was definately a good buy, especially for those wishing to be close to downtown and who are traveling by car.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: RobertSuzanne
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay in the Lake Union area of Seattle and this was an excellent find. I had never heard of this hotel, but if you are in the Seattle area, there are several to choose from. The room and the bathroom were clean, bright and roomy. The breakfast is well prepared, well stocked and many choices. Enjoyed using the pool and hot tub. Free parking was a big plus. There are many restaurants within walking distance. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: joseotavio
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at a discounted price through Priceline and it proved to be a great value (even if I paid full price). The room was very spacious and comfortable, they offer a very good complimentary breakfast, free Wi-Fi and free parking! The hotel location is also very good, you can walk 5 minutes and take a bus or enjoy their free shuttle service, it runs every 30 minutes and takes you to the Space Needle and Pike Place Market. There are also some good restaurants nearby, we ate at a seafood place called Duke's Chowder House and it was delicious (there's also a crab house and sushi place very close to the hotel). Overall, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: yankeejones
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights and we absolutely loved it. The rooms were clean and comfy, view was great, and the free shuttle was a wonderful bonus. Unlike most of the downtown hotels parking is free here and with the free shuttle we could get downtown in just a matter of minutes. The front desk people were super helpful. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find for the family”
Reviews.Author: happylodger
Reviews.Content: My family loves this hotel. My kids always want to stay at the "seaplane hotel" when we are in Seattle. They love the breakfast, and I love the sitting room with the beautiful view over Lake Union. They have washers and dryers available and a pool that is great for the kids. That staff is great. I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay- loved every minute!!”
Reviews.Author: louise b
Reviews.Content: Just had a great experience at Silver Cloud on Lake Union. We will definitely go back. The staff couldn't be nicer, the room was delightful- a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Doctore
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent - king size bed and TV, good size and very clean. Courtesy shuttle bus into the city was great. Changing rooms for pool would help. Communal areas a little tired looking. No restaurant or bar though breakfast was fine. Some good service, some not so good. Overall effect was that hotel lacks a bit of sparkle.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back - uncomfortable room, package stolen from parking lot”
Reviews.Author: SafetyMD
Reviews.Content: Room - The room is a suite that should accommodate a family of four. Unfortunately, the air conditioning is only in the bedroom. With the pocket door closed, there was no air conditioning for my boys on the pull-out couch. In addition, the configuration of the room made it such that you could not move around when the couch was out. Very uncomfortable. Security - We were attending a wedding. My husband put the gift on the bench for a few minutes when he went to get the car (literally from the other side of the wall). When he returned the gift was gone. I assume that there are no security cameras as the hotel was not able to help us retrieve our stolen gift. Food - The breakfast was plentiful and varied. A highlight of the hotel. Location - The hotel is on the Lake - a plus - and they had a free shuttle - another plus, but if you want to go to Pike's Market, etc., it is not particularly convenient. I spent a lot of time in traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveler711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights and were very pleased. Location was great---our room overlooked Lake Union. The room size was adequate. The breakfast food and dining room were beyond our expectation. The hotel was very clean and the staff very courteous. Usually we like to stay at a five star but because of a family gathering, we elected to stay at The Silver Cloud Inn and would definitely stay there again even as a single couple.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SallyFoodie
Reviews.Content: Pros - Aveda bath products free van service to downtown patio to enjoy a cocktail or wine and cheese dinner free "breakfast" free parking Cons - slow, slow, slow.....they are still not here elevators ... and no stairs to be found 2 bath towels provided daily; and 1 if not both were postage stamp thin traffic noise began at 7 a.m. Van service needs to be reserved ahead of time....way ahead of time No bar onsite Breakfast consists of bagels, toasts, rubbery waffles, cereal, muffins, powdered eggs, and rubbery sausage. see the theme here? coffee, juice, teas ONLY Struggling to rate the cleanliness of rooms or the staff friendliness, helpfulness - both were hit and miss/ok

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because the ratings were SO positive, however we were disappointed. The hotel is just OK, not as good as an Embassy Suites. OK location however there is no store nearby so bring your own water and snacks or you have to pick some up at the poorly stocked one in the hotel. The pool was really disappointing for the kids - small, quite dark and a bit dingy. My daughter found a screw in the hot tub. On the positive side, the staff was extremely courteous, welcoming, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: daytripdreamz
Reviews.Content: For the area you cannot beat the price of this hotel, nothing overly fancy but has everything you need... walking distance to the water, a bit further to coffee shops but close to transit that will get you anywhere... can walk to the space needle... Lobby has free coffee/tea and it was GOOD.... we had complimentary breakfast available..did not have time for the breakfast but we enjoyed eating out at various places so can't comment on breakfast but the price of the room was good for the location in comparison to surrounding hotels. Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.....”
Reviews.Author: icarol
Reviews.Content: We are a family four and found this hotel a great value for the money. Free parking, free breakfast and free shuttle to most attractions. Rooms were clean, and staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: suitcase49
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Silver Cloud - Lake Union. The staff was courteous, friendly, and helpful. The shuttle to downtown was free, and easy to access. The drivers were fast, and the service lasts until 11pm. We never had to wait more than 15-20 minutes and once we got the hang of it we'd just call a bit ahead and the wait was maybe 10 mins. The complimentary breakfast was plentiful (eggs,sausage, waffles, bagels, cereal, fruit) and there was an outdoor dining area. The pool / spa / fitness room were all well maintained and housekeeping did a great job. My son forgot his belt during the pack-up and housekeeping found it and brought it right down. We originally scheduled a shuttle service from the hotel to the airport,(78.00) but it was unnecessary. The hotel will set up a town car (45.00) or you can take their shuttle to Pioneer Square = from downtown Seattle the taxi fare to SeaTac is fixed at 32.00. Great time.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit was as nice as the 1st!"”
Reviews.Author: SteveCDecatur
Reviews.Content: A little out of the way for some but not too far from downtown to walk (or take the free shuttle). Very good breakfast in big, upstairs room overlooking the lake. Comfortable clean rooms; A/C was a little loud but not enough to really cause lost sleep. Nice pool area. Friendly staff. Parking is free but can be cramped for anything larger than a subcompact. Several good restaurants in walking distance. Quieter area overall, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with lake view”
Reviews.Author: rindradjaja
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our vacation in July. We have 3 young children, ages 8, 5, and 3. The location is very good. If you stay in rooms facing Lake Union, the view is very nice and you can see Space Needle from your room. On July 4, you can see the fireworks from your room. Just make sure that you stay in high floors (6 or 7). Rooms are spacious, clean, and breakfast is nice but crowded during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Convenient---Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Gina-G78
Reviews.Content: So glad we picked this hotel- Great location near the trolley that goes straight into downtown. Right on beautiful Lake Union near the house boats. Plentiful breakfast! Cozy beds-Great water pressure in the showers- Aveda bath products-Tully's coffee-Free Garage Parking! Sign me up again for next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: princessbride029
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights during our long road trip in western North America, and were very happy with our stay! Our room cost an average of $179/night. The location is really great – we were skeptical at first that it would be too far from the city center/sites, but it was actually perfect. The hotel’s free shuttle gets you to the Space Needle in literally 2 minutes, and it’s just a few more to get to Pike’s Market or Pioneer Square. (Once we got downtown, we actually walked from Pioneer Square to the public library, then down to the waterfront and all the way over to the Space Needle, where we picked up the free shuttle again. A long walk, but very pleasant and lots of parks and attractions along the way). The hotel is across a small street from Lake Union and has nice views (although ours was a partial view that included a parking lot), and multiple restaurants are within walking distance – we recommend Duke’s Chowderhouse!! Tip for using the free shuttle: BOOK AHEAD! We got lucky once with a last minute ride, but other times we called and the next available time was an hour or more away. The staff at the hotel was friendly, and check-in was quick and easy. A basket of apples is available at the desk, which I thought was a nice touch. The room was very clean and a good size. The shower was good with excellent water pressure. We appreciated the free wireless internet and complimentary continental breakfast (basic hot/cold cereal, whole fruit, yogurt, muffins, scrambled eggs and sausage, and a waffle maker!). Free parking was another HUGE bonus – most hotels charge outrageous amounts per night. Overall, we really loved the location and amenities at this hotel and would definitely stay here again if and when we return to Seattle! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyed the stay; lots of little extras made it pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: CrystalVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one Friday night, for a concert downtown at Benaroya Hall. We chose the hotel based on TA reviews and were not at all disappointed. The hotel is located not too far off I-5 and fairly easy to find. Check-in was quick -- we had reserved online. Although the hotel was completely full, we got the room we had asked for: quiet, away from elevators/drink machines, and close to fire exit. We received a top floor (7th floor) room which was nice, bit of a view. The room was spacious and clean. We had a semi-corner room with a fireplace; not sure if they all have one. Fridge and microwave too. Aveda shampoo/conditioner. Bed was fine. Aside from a bit of pipe noise, the room was as quiet as we had hoped. There was a large flat-screen wall-mounted TV. Breakfast in the morning was very good, with lots of selection. At 8:30 it was a bit difficult to find a table but the crowd thinned out a later. However, we did not have to wait for either food or a table, just look around -- somewhat impressive considering the hotel was full. It helped that the weather was decent and people could sit outside. The hotel has lots of nice extras, starting with the free parking which we didn't really expect. We used the free shuttle to downtown, and tipped generously as the driver took us right to Benaroya Hall (I particularly appreciated not having to start the evening with a 5-block walk in high heels). Free coffee/tea in the lobby all day, including a decent-tasting decaf. The little store in the lobby has fairly reasonable prices. Free wifi throughout was easy to access. Finally, they have pre-printed instructions at the front desk about how to get to I-5 from the hotel and how to return, very clear and easy to follow. The three "free" (included in price) extras -- parking, wifi, breakfast -- gave this stay an amazingly good value for money. We received an express check-out bill under the door -- no surprises. We did not check out the fitness centre or use the pool. I might be more inclined to use the pool at another time of year -- in August there were lots of small children who tend to... We were very happy with the stay and, from now on, this will likely be our first choice to stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle Service!”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker68
Reviews.Content: When looking for a place to stay in Seattle this place hit the mark for our family. Free parking. Breakfast included. Pool. Shuttle service to local sights. Breakfast had all the standards, pastries, cereals, yogurts, waffles, bacon and eggs. It's a nice, bright dining area with plenty of tables. The shuttle service was great with drop off and pick up when requested at the Space Needle, Underground Tour or Pikes Place Market. The shuttle also would also do drop off and pick ups in the evenings at local restaurants. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable about local restaurants and had recommendations for every budget. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Seattle and have recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the location”
Reviews.Author: arrowflight
Reviews.Content: We were attending a wedding that concluded with a trip on the Virginia V, leaving from Lake Union. This location was perfect, and would be for many reasons. There's a street car that runs by the front door and takes you downtown. The parking is free! (and secure). Our room was clean and pleasant, and the breakfast offered was more than adequate. Well worth a stay, particularly if you have an interest in the Lake Union area as well as downtown. Given their rates, I'd look at it closely before opting for a 'downtown' highrise hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Big rooms and free parking and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Anastasios73
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the size of the rooms. Had complimentary parking and Internet. Good location. Shuttle service to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocoj
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, friendly front desk service, excellent breakfast buffet, free parking and shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie409
Reviews.Content: Three of us ladies stayed here the beginning of August, 2011, I picked this hotel for the free shuttle and breakfast, we enjoyed a dip in the pool, the breakfast sausage was excellent, the waffles hot and fresh, enough choices to start a healthy day in my mind, the rooms and common areas were clean. The front desk staff more than accomodating, the daytime shuttle driver was excellent. The afternoon shuttle driver left something to be desired.He left the stop at Pike Market before I could get settled, after a day of shopping and touring, the body does not always work the same as first thing in the morning and this was a back jarring experince, following that he tried to take on a Seattle Transit bus and of course would have lost so chose to stay in his lane, then he cut a right hand corner and clipped the curb with the step, sending packages and people flying in the air.. left a complaint with the front desk staff expected an email from the hotel managment but to this date have received none. Would I stay again yes, would I take the shuttle with that driver,, not if I could help it...

Reviews.Title: “The Best for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Seredni
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud Inn is not fancy, but it's about the best deal you'll find in Seattle proper. It's located along a bus and trolly line, easy driving distance to the UW (if you know your way), Fred H., and downtown. It's also an easy drive to Magnolia, Queen Anne, and Fremont. My room was clean and quiet, although I didn't have a view. I had a shower and a bathtub, although the bathtub was in the room with the beds (it was a jacuzzi). Aveda soaps . . .non smoking, comfortable bed, free HBO, quick elevators. Parking was great. I traveled along and did not feel afraid to park in the garage. I never struggled to find a spot. I used my room key to get into the locked and lighted garage. Free breakfasts are okay, not great. Lots of carbs, powdered scrambled eggs (that tasted fine to me), some meats, toast, bagels, muffins, milk, juice, tea and coffee. There were also a few waffle makers. Very few fruits. Cereals. There is a workout room that was adequate. I used an elliptical type machine without any problems. Clean and safe. The music was blaring but I was able to find the control and turn it down. Quick check in and check out. I highly recommend this hotel if you're not looking for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Doulamom
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel was so informative and nice. We got there early for check in and they had no problem with us parking in their locked garage and taking the free shuttle to the space needle. Our room was big enough for the five of us, with two queens and a pull out bed. The pool was open 24 hours, the breakfast was good- scrambeld eggs, waffles, sausage, yogurt, fruits, cereal, baked goods. The shuttles were terrific. Sign up at the front desk, call when you want to be picked up. My only complaint was that the water pressure could have been a little stronger.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great shuttle, and very good value.”
Reviews.Author: xxxadixxx
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was a good value and we selected it based on TA reviews. The location is out of the way, but this was a good thing for us. We used the shuttle service a few times a day and it was exactly what we needed. Any time we called, they were ready for us in 10-20 minutes. Our room was a great size and clean. The jacuzzi tub was a nice touch. As other reviewers indicated, the breakfast was a bit lacking, but it got the job done. The silver cloud staff did all they could to make our stay great and they succeeded. Everyone was friendly and interested in helping in any way they could. We enjoyed our stay and would return if we go back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: DMac604
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my wife and two kids. We arrived early and the front desk were happy to check our luggage for us while we left for exploring Seattle. The staff then took down my cell and called be later that day when the room was ready, allowing us to check in 2 hours early(which was nice) They offered a free shuttle service but we preferred to drive as our children require child seats for safety. Parking was free, which is s nice bonus in Seattle! The room had free WiFi but it's slow (like 1 MB/s). I think they could use an upgraded router. The room was nice and offered a stunning view of lake Union and the Space Needle. The lake is an interesting view with lots of activity like seaplanes landing/taking off, paddle boats, rowing races and kayakers. The free breakfast was an added bonus and is served in a fantastic viewing lounge that offers a conservatory, patio, regular tables, and a living room with fireplace, window seat, and floor to ceiling book cases. The breakfast was well stocked and offered scrambled eggs, sausages, toast, bagels, english muffins, yogurt, fruit, cereal, and waffles. Oh, and Tully's coffee, assorted teas, milk and juices. They also offer free Tully's coffee and assorted teas 24hrs in the 3rd flr and main lobbies which is a nice touch. The room has a fridge and a microwave which comes in handy for popcorn and keeping beverages chilled! Would definitely stay here again. Great value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kcjenny
Reviews.Content: Originally, my friend and I planned to stay with friends, but when that fell through at the last minute we needed a hotel quick. Silver Cloud was the only one with a room available, and needless to say we weren't that excited about paying an extra 100 bucks each (total about $200) for one night. However, it turned out to be worth it! The front desk was super accommodating - they had information about the race we were in town for, and didn't give us any grief for checking out 30 minutes late. The bed was comfy and the complimentary hot breakfast tasty - they even had plain yogurt! Close to the bus stop and within walking distance to downtown. Right across the street is Lake Union. I almost wish I'd stayed the whole trip there.

Reviews.Title: “good location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: druryperry
Reviews.Content: A hop, skip and a jump from the upscale University Village Shopping Center and next to the University of Washington area, this is a decent place to stay. It was very busy the night we were there and some kind of a convention was happening as the lobby was filled with people both when we arrived and left the next day but it was clean, comfortable and supplied what we needed. The exercise room was bigger than most and the free breakfast included hot food which was nice. While there was nothing outstanding about the Silver Cloud, neither was there anything to complain about. We'd choose it again, should we be looking for something in that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were here longer! You'll love the shuttle service!!”
Reviews.Author: ecatsam
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud's staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the location. Free parking, free internet and free breakfast were a great combination! The rooms were spacious and clean. Wish we were in the room long enough to enjoy it more. Lots of trendy restaurants and bars within walking distance. It was nice having coffee and tea in the lobby at all hours. The best feature about Silver Cloud though is its free shuttle service! They had 3 destinations: Pike's Market, Pioneer Square and the Space Needle. All you had to do was call the hotel to let them know you wanted to be picked up or dropped off. It was wonderful since all the reviews I read said parking was ridiculous in Seattle. Thank you Silver Cloud for making our stay in Seattle more enjoyable than expected. We had a party of 10 and we all agreed we'd love to stay here again! Only downside: garage parking is great especially when it's free but you won't be able to fit a minivan with a cargo compartment on its roof. The other family we travelled with had to pay for parking on an outdoor lot next to the hotel. The free shuttle service more than made up for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and beautiful view!”
Reviews.Author: mkposhgie
Reviews.Content: I am very particular about having a clean room and this was perfect! The continental breakfast is delicious with scrambled eggs, yogurt, oatmeal, toast, waffles, sausage, muffins and more. We had a view of the lake and it was definitely worth the minimal cost in upgrade. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is only a 5-10 minute drive from downtown. You can even walk it if you have the time because there was plenty to see along the way. They do offer complimentary shuttle to downtown and back, though remember to schedule just in case the van fills up. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, friendly staff and a good quality establishment”
Reviews.Author: seafloorscott
Reviews.Content: Across the street from Lake Union and within walking distance of the South Lake Union (SLU) shopping and dining area. The room was typical of major business chains, but the free (and fast) wi-fi and free exercise rooms were a definite perk not given at major chains. In particular, the exercise room had new equipment in good repair and a full rack of dumbbells which was far above the quality of other complimentary exercise facilities I've seen. The views of Lake Union from the upper floors are great. Their breakfast room was a light-filled sunroom with scrambled eggs, sausages, waffles and all manner of muffins. Good coffee too - Tully's.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced.....nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: USSRN1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night. The hotel is well-used one. Everything is kinda clean....but you can see that it's very well used..... scratchy....greyish linen....a bit smelly....and the staff is not so friendly. I guess, they are having no problem with tenants, so they do not bother too much to take care about the guests....their attitude is like this "you don't like it....well that's your problem", something like this. Our toilet was clogged.... They did unclogged it promptly, but never said sorry or something like that. The good feature is the only one - shuttle bus to downtown Seattle. That's it. Tooo overpriced. My advice to you - do not stay in Downtown unless absolutely necessary! Stay on the outskirts, you will find cheaper and cleaner hotels, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “This was an oasis for us”
Reviews.Author: toosietrip
Reviews.Content: Free parking and a place to pull in temporarily while checking in were great features. Very friendly front desk and nice big lobby with computers and printers to use (great for boarding passes), plus juicy apples. Wi-fi in room worked just fine. Free laundry machines. Surprise free afternoon reception on Tuesday. Large breakfast variety (eggs, sausage, bagels, muffins, make-your-own waffles, juices, fruits). Pool and hot tub were great, with lots of fresh towels. The air is very hot in the pool room, though -- better to be in the pool than just sitting and watching kids. Free shuttle to several tourist spots, and just call to have them come pick you up. Room was very clean and spacious. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rockguy23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just as described on their website. We stayed 3 nights in a Lake view room. Best things: Shuttle service to Downtown, free parking, hot breakfast included, friendly knowledgable staff. Location is near to the trolley if you want to take it into toewn as well. Watch seaplanes take off out of your window. All in all a great stay. Would def stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JaneWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Free shuttle to four different stops in Seattle was very helpful, but the hotel did offer free parking as well. Drivers were very friendly and helpful. Front desk staff were very nice and one of the guys saved us from losing our luggage. Free breakfast was very good, only problem was finding a place to sit on crowded mornings. Plenty of food though.

Reviews.Title: “I hate to sound like a broken record. . ."”
Reviews.Author: Martrese
Reviews.Content: . . .but I have to agree with all the positive reviews. Husband & I stayed here for a nearby half marathon and we couldn't have been happier with our hotel choice. The free parking, WiFi, view of Lake Union, stylishly renovated room decor, delish breakfast, shuttle to downtown - everything was well worth the reasonable room rate. We really enjoyed strolling along the docks, inspecting the boats. Chandler's Crab House (just south of the hotel on the water) has a great happy hour and brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay, next to the Lake with easy access to downtown”
Reviews.Author: lopezbiker
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location near Lake Union in the new 'neighborhood' in town. The rooms are comfortable, very clean, with a refrigerator and microwave. Breakfast is served in the morning. Several restaurants on the lake or a short ride on the trolley or hotel shuttle to downtown. They also offer shuttle service to the baseball of football games. A pleasant change from the hustle and bustle of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Meems07
Reviews.Content: There's really nothing negative to say about this hotel. It had everything you could want for the area. The shuttle is a great option to have and it goes to three areas pioneer square, pikes places, and the needle. Also, getting picked up from the areas was a breeze, just a quick call and they give you an ETA of when to be at the stop. The space needle is down the way, so you could walk it if you wanted. Alot to see just even across the street from the hotel. Alot of paths are available for you to walk/run/bike. The hotel itself has such a nice work out facility that you would feel guilty if you didn't use it. Breakfast was actually better than I expected and what a great view to drink yourmorning coffee in. If you are in a room facing the lake, you even get a fireplace in your room. All Aveda products for those using hotel shampoos etc. And a morning paper every day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: tomandcynthia
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have been on the road almost four weeks so we are getting to know our way around B&B's and hotels :-) We had never heard of Silver Cloud properties but after reading reviews thought we would give them a try and were not disappointed. Our rooms were spotless and nice size; front desk very courteous and helpful when asked about restaurants; nice internet speed; some of the things mentioned about other Silver Cloud properties were missing at this property, a little disappointing (example, living room with drinks and snacks on each floor -- I could find that anywhere on the fifth floor at this location but it was a maze so I might have completely missed it). There is no restaurant at this location but you are in the center of some great places to eat so that's not a big deal. If you don't want to get out, they have several places that will deliver to the hotel. You are five minutes from the Space Needle, which for a tourist, is a must-visit. Our room had a view of Lake Union which was wonderful. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle service makes a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Pippi011
Reviews.Content: Not a wow hotel but nice enough standard rooms with a pretty view, the staff are extremely helpful and the shuttlevto downtown made this a nice pick for a post Alaska cruise stay

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: wlncl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything it said and more. The staff allowed our party of 12 to use the breakfast room for our take in dinner in the evening. The breakfast room has wonderful views. We asked the staff about getting taxis to take several of the party to the cruise pier and were advised to come to the desk in the morning and they would call for us. In the morning we had a call from the desk asking if we had forgotten we needed to call for the taxis. Great service! The only problem was the hot tub had an excess of chemicals and those in our party who wanted to use it were not able to. Jeff and all the staff were just great, kudos to all. We will definitely stay here when we are in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mommaw1966
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 day stay at this hotel. It was awesome! Our room was wonderful, the breakfast room is beautiful with a wonderful selection of items. The people at the reception desk were so helpful with information. David at front desk gave us wonderful suggestions for restaurants for dinner and van drivers, Kenny and Paul, were so helpful in taking us around. We found this on the internet thru Trip Advisor and are so glad we did. Wish these folks had hotels in other areas as they do everything with class! And parking of car is free....does it get any better??? We would definitely stay here again if our travels take us back to Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay...clean, well-maintained, good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: LibraryLady328
Reviews.Content: Three family members and I stayed here for one night before departing on an Alaskan cruise. I can't recommend it enough, plus it has a nice view of the lake across the street. They were very nice about calling us a taxi the next morning for transportation to the cruise terminal. I asked if their van could shuttle us there, but the answer was no...too bad because it would be a great service. Complimentary breakfast is served in a nice large, pleasant room on one of the upper floors and there was a lovely outdoor area for eating, as well, but a bit too chilly to make use of it that morning. Would stay here again in a heartbeat, even though it was a bit beyond what we had planned to spend. The hotel is in a nice area...I believe it's on the same street as the Space Needle. I seem to remember passing it in the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “I will go back”
Reviews.Author: OldStylePilsner
Reviews.Content: Lake Union us not in downtown, but is close by everything, and the Silver Cloud hotel is a good place to stay. Clean and quiet hotel. Free parking. Free breakfast, which was quite good. The restaurants in the area are not great, but it is a short trolley ride to downtown, walking distance to the Space Needle, short drive to the Woodland Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: AnnWhalley
Reviews.Content: Since we had a car we were looking for someplace that was centrally located and did not charge for parking. This turned out to be perfect. The hotel is clean & comfortable w/good siza rooms and good breakfasts, the staff were very helpful. And....the best part......free shuttle service to the Space Needle, Pike's Market and Pioneer Square. For return, you just call and they come to get you. Also, there are several nice restaurants with water views right across the street. We had a very enjoyable stay there.

Reviews.Title: “This Silver Cloud doesn't live up to others”
Reviews.Author: tacomarick
Reviews.Content: Well…chose this Silver Cloud based off our other great visits to Silver Clouds (Bellevue and Stadium). I was a little disappointed in this one for various reasons which I will mention. It served its purpose for our overnight stay, but I booked so far in advance, I should have just chose somewhere closer to what I needed for cheaper. Maybe I am being a little picky on this visit, but I have come to love the Silver Clouds and this one fell short. Check in: easy, no issues. Parking is free which is nice but getting even a compact car in to a spot is like threading a needle…I was just glad not to have any dents when I got back. Rooms: I was fine with the room and impressed with the space. King bed, fridge, relaxing chair, table, etc. Didn’t see a safe anywhere unless I’m blind. I like having a safe these days. But the room was clean, although there were only two towels in the room. Really, two towels? Usually these days you get four. Probably because they were actually full they shorted to make up for it. The hallways leading to the room is like a maze and I have never seen anything like it in a hotel. It was confusing and not enough signs saying where rooms, elevators, etc were. They have a free shuttle you have to sign up for. They have 14 seats on it which is fine unless the hotel is full. We decided to cab it anyway, but front desk couldn’t get a hold of a cab for us. We walked down towards the restaurants and found one. Breakfast: free breakfast is always nice, but whoever designed this hotels breakfast area should be slapped! And it is obvious this hotel is not prepared to be full. It was an absolute cluster. Not enough seating, not enough food, not enough dishes, etc..people everywhere, no rhyme or reason to how you line up to get food, people shoving in from every which way. Not good. Like I said the room served its purpose but I’ll pass on this one in the future. oh and if theres a pizza flyer in there from Pizza & Pasta Roma don't order from them..got delivery, screwed it up twice..never did get the right pizza

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: baytravellers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a four night pre-cruise trip to Seattle because of the consistently good reviews. And Silver Cloud Lake Union deserved every good comment it received. We had a Lake View Room - a large comfortable room which gave us an endlessly interesting view of the activities on the lake. The hotel has lots of positives - breakfast included in the room rate, free internet access, free laundry facilities, a weekly (Tuesday) management cocktail party and of course the regular shuttle service in to town. All the staff were friendly and helpful and we really enjoyed our stay. We thoroughly recommend this as a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Free Amenities”
Reviews.Author: 2Kolohe
Reviews.Content: Found this place by accident when looking online. Had reservations at another hotel close by, but when I saw what this place was offering and money being tight, I had to say I have absolutely no regrets having stayed here. If you're looking to save some money then consider the Silver Cloud an option. My friends and I stayed here, and they were very happy with the stay. Here's what we liked: 1. Free Parking - every other place charges $20 - $50 a night just to park. If you think I'm lying trying looking around. 2. Free Breakfast - a great selection from hot & cold cereal, bagels, toast, waffles, etc. Get there early as it does get crowded. But never had a problem with them running out of food. 3. Shuttle - OMG! They shuttle you to the popular sites: Space Needle, Pike's Market, and Pioneer Square. Call them when you're done and they pick you up. Best part we didn't have to wait no more than 10 minutes at any given time. Now that's service. And it's FREE 4. Rooms - we had a room with a view of Lake Union. Got to see the float planes take off and land. Great view of the Space Needle at night. Spacious, free newspaper, and WI FI! 5. Check In - a breeze. They we're so fast! 6. Workers - the best of the best make no doubt about that. Friendly, funny, helpful, and professional. Inquired about how far Daniels Broiler was from the hotel and the guy who drove the shuttle said it was down the way, and asked if I needed reservations. Told him we already had reservations and instead of us driving to the place he said that he'd drop us off and to call the hotel when we were done. That was awesome 7. Coffee, or tea available in the lobby 24/7. Didn't have a chance to make use of the pool or work out area, but did see people using the facilities. While the hotel is not located in the heart of downtown Seattle, the amenities and services that they do provided makes up for that in a heartbeat. Also, many eateries are located within a 5 -7 minute walk. In the end, I loved this little place. If and when I return to Seattle, this hotel is where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Cloud Nine”
Reviews.Author: mikegreen
Reviews.Content: Seattle was the first stop on our mini tour of the Pacific Northwest and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Silver Cloud - Lake Union. The front desk staff were very welcoming, sorry guys we cannot remember your names!, and we were allocated our room. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable and all fixtures and fittings worked and were of good quality. The only negative during our stay, due to where we were located in the hotel, was the early morning wake up due to the trash track visiting at 5.30am! Other than this the room was quiet and there was no disturbance from other guests at all. Breakfast was good and filling with a variety to suit most tastes, we liked the waffle making machines! Location was good for the Space Needle and the Experience Music Project as well as most everything else. Situated just over the street from Lake Union the hotel was nicely situated, nice to just stroll around the local area with yachts, restaurants and the lake and shore. We were glad of this as although it might have been handier to have been staying more centrally we did appreciated the quieter, prettier, area the Silver Cloud is located in. The free hotel shuttle to various downtown locations (most of the major tourist hotspots) was a boon and we give a special shout out to Paul the driver who went out of was for us. Also big thanks to the other shuttle driver, I'm sorry Sir we forgot your name too, who drove us door to door for a meeting when it was tipping with rain. All in all a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great hotel with free breakfast, shuttle to downtown”
Reviews.Author: pinokarina
Reviews.Content: Super value. I paid $130/night and stayed here with my husband. The hotel is overall great. Clean, nice rooms with fridge. Lots of freebees like full breakfast (waffles, toast, muffins, fresh eggs, sausage, juices, teas, coffee, fruit etc), parking, shuttle to downtown (3 pickup and drop off locations), wifi, 24 hour gym & pool. It's right across from Lake union so there are really nice daytime and night time views. Great steakhouse (Daniels) and sushi restaurants right across the street. Only down is that i had a business meeting and wanted to use their conference room if free during a weekend and the receptionist didn't really put any effort into seeing if it was a possibility or booked and just said no.

Reviews.Title: “Its a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireFromVancouver
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about writing a review for the Silver Cloud Inn Lake Union, because it is such a hidden gem, I fear sending more people there will make it harder for me to book. But due credit. Had to find a last minute place in Seattle, and they were near a business location I had to visit. The things that attracted me were the free secure parking, the free shuttle service to downtown Seattle, and the free breakfast. These were all prefect, they are not too far from Pike Place Market, didn’t have to use my car at all, and breakfast was simple but good in variety and quality. I asked for a quiet room, and got one. I had a sound, undistrubed sleep. There was a nice fireplace in the room, and free wireless. It was a simple, clean room, nothing too fancy. The staff were very nice. It is a great location, a nice, safe and interesting corner of Seattle, next to the water. I might have used the pool, but it was crowded with lots of moms with small children, and I didn’t want to intrude. This will definitely be my go-to spot for Seattle in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but too much chlorine in the pool”
Reviews.Author: jklm11
Reviews.Content: I also never bother with reviews but wanted to write this as a caution to parents with very young children. There is way too much chlorine in the pool! The smell was awful and my eyes were burning from just sitting in the hot tub. I also saw the maintenance guy dump another cup of chlorine into the hot tub while we were there! Was very disappointed that we could not let our kids stay in the pool very long. Another negative was that the sheets were so scratchy I could not get comfortable. Overall though, it's a good deal with the free breakfast and parking. Our view of the lake was amazing. I would come back but sans children.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Annely5
Reviews.Content: Normally I wouldn't bother with writing a review, but this place is too good not to write about. First, great location and free shuttle service to downtown. Plus, free on-site parking. Second, 24-hour pool/hot tub. Need I say more? Finally, microwaves and fridges in the rooms. How great is that?! Oh! And the breakfast! Better than the cafe we went to down the street and almost as good as Denmark (the gold standard in my book :) ). The staff was helpful and friendly and they made our stay fantastic. Truly a hidden gem; great value.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more. Delightful.”
Reviews.Author: Krisrose02
Reviews.Content: Me and my two sons (3, and 9) very much enjoyed our stay at the Silver Cloud in Lake Union. We arrived in Seattle by Amtrak (a 40 hour train ride.) We were early for check in, but the hotel sent a shuttle to pick us up and allowed us to check in early since they had a clean room ready. This was much appreciated! We had a Lake view room which was spacious, clean, and had a nice view of the marina and lake. The mini fridge and microwave were very useful for storing snacks for the kids. The room was quiet and restful even for afternoon naps for the young one. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful. Coffee and juice, waffles with fruit topping, eggs and sausages, cereal, muffins, bagels, yogurt, and fresh fruit. Truly something for everyone, it was a great start to the day. The shuttle service was invaluable. We did not rent a car but found that we really didn't need one. The street car station was a couple of blocks away and everything was walkable or available by shuttle from the hotel. The drivers were kind and helpful. Though checkout was at noon and our train back did not leave until nearly 5 pm, the hotel held our bags and offered us full use of the hotel facilities and shuttle until our departure. The Silver Cloud went above and beyond our expectations. We would most definitely return to this hotel for future visits to the Emerald City.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: iridiscent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because my meeting location was nearby. I was only here for 3 nights/2 days but was very impressed by the size and cleanliness of the room as well as how friendly the staff were. The location is not ideal as it is some way away from downtown and there aren't many shops/restaurants around but there is a free shuttle service that departs from the hotel every 30 minutes. Breakfast was included in the room rate and was extremely basic - scrambled eggs, sausages, toast, waffles, instant oatmeal and cereal. Probably the only thing that really let me down about this hotel, otherwise it was a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel with fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: HampshireDiamond
Reviews.Content: this hotel was one of the best i have stayed in. good location, excellent staff & nothing is too much trouble. my trip was with work colleagues as we went for a conference. the complimentary breakfast was fantastic, with a very good selection, staff are very helpful & work very hard to make your stay a great one, if u need anything just ask! this hotel is a real credit to their owners. on our days not working we visited pike market - please go there what an experience! there is a famous fish stall- the workers are quite crazy! they sing & dance & it is very funny & they may even chuck a giant fish for you to catch! please please visit the space needle - wow what can i say fantastic & well worth it - dont go if u hate heights!!! we also booked a table one evening in seattles famous space needle revolving restaurant - what a view & the food was most delicious & beautifully presented.My pudding - liquid nitrogen ice cream was amazing as our table filled with smoke quite an experience! Experience Music Project, the interactive museum - this was a great day out got to find out loads about music legends & also sing in your own music booth & play with different instruments- great for any wannabe song or music artists!! being a big martial arts fan, Bruce lee & his son brandon lee are buried in seattle, not too far from our hotel so i couldnt miss this opportunity of not paying my respects to a great legend & his son, so we caught a taxi & at the office a member of staff gave us directions to their graves. on a lighter note! shopping is fantastic, real bargains on all the us designers such as levi ,old navy, gap, ralph lauren etc plenty of nice places to eat for everyone. had the most amazing time here in Seattle & will go back with the whole family

Reviews.Title: “BREAKFAST WITH A VIEW OF LAKE UNION!”
Reviews.Author: Jujubaby00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was voted by our family of four as the best one that we stayed at in our month long tour of the West Coast of the US. The rooms were more upmarket and comfortable than other hotels on our trip and the gym was outstanding. The yummy breakfast overlooking stunning Lake Union was a fabulous way to start the day before taking the free shuttle into the city. With free parking and free wi-fi the Silver Cloud was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Atomique
Reviews.Content: I came to Seattle for an important meeting and this was where the local company put me up. I liked this hotel a lot and made me look up other locations for when I stay in the Pacific Northwest. Reasonably priced for the amenities. Short cab ride from the Amtrak station. The front desk was very helpful. Homey lobby feel. I wouldn't have minded a restaurant or bar in the hotel but there is plenty nearby. I walked around the neighborhood by myself at night and it didn't seem sketchy at all, in fact I started looking at condos in the area that night on the net. The room was good sized and clean. Mini fridge and microwave. Free wifi. Large flat screen TV. Room was modern and comfy. Nice clean comfy bed. Nice vanity area and Aveda goodies. Bathroom was clean and fair sized. Definitively a great deal for Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved everything about this hotel"”
Reviews.Author: walter1326
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay in the Seattle area often while visiting our family. This hotel is in a great location at Union Lake - visited the Woodenboat Museum right there - nice restaurants in walking distance; they offer a shuttle service downtown. The view was great overlooking the water; they have complimentary drinks on Tuesday evenings, a great breakfast, a nice pool and spa - exercise gym. Sheets on the inside and outside of your blanket, a complimentary newspaper, free parking. It is absolutely the best place in Seattle. Price was right with AARP discounts offered. The friendliest, most helpful staff working there. They must be treated well!! You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for a Seattle stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Shineygirl
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a family friendly hotel wih a swimming pool, complimentary breakfast and free parking located within easy access of downtown Seattle and this hotel delivered! The views from the bedrooms and the breakfast room are great. There was a good variety at breakfast; fruit, make-your-own waffles, toast, yoghurt, scrambled eggs, sausages..... Being able to leave your car and take the shuttle around Seattle was excellent. We also used the shuttle to go to local restaurants.
