The hotel staff were very helpful in their suggestions on where to go/ what to eat. I am bored of faceless impersonal large hotel chains and the Silver Cloud Lake Union provides a welcome change. The bathrooms are very small and a suite for a family of 4 would have been a preference but apart from that, we would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kelly58759
Reviews.Content: I arranged a meeting at the Lake Union Silver Cloud with Sunny. She and her staff were fabulous. The accommodations couldn't have been better! The spectacular vies of the water just added to an over-all wonderful meeting for friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A place I will return to year after year”
Reviews.Author: pamboyle
Reviews.Content: We took the light rail from the airport into the city and then a bus right to the hotel. Total time 45 minutes. The staff were warmly welcoming and very efficient. But, really, it's the hotel that stands out. We stayed on the 7th floor which looked out over the Lake. The french doors opened to give a lovely breeze. We had friends staying in other rooms and each room was charmingly decorated, each bed just as comfy. There were pocket doors to create separate spaces. And, in the morning a complimentary hot breakfast, which sent us on our way into the downtown to explore on Seattle's fabulous public transit system. This is the hotel we will come back to year after year. It was a wonderful experience staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with pool on Lake Union; good base to drive around and see Seattle”
Reviews.Author: dprreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 young kids on a summer vacation. One of the big draws was the pool, which we used every day. Rooms were fine (we stayed two separate times; once for the beginning of the trip in one room, and once in a suite for our last night.) The location requires a car, but I think Seattle in general requires a car, so that wasn't a problem. Overall good experience here.

Reviews.Title: “No frills...great value”
Reviews.Author: leonardcohen2010
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, but everything needed was in hand. People are kind and efficient. I was impressed at the local restaurant list they gave when I asked, starving. Types of food, waking time and distance and budget were indicated exactly. Very helpful. They are running swimming pool, fitness and business center 24 hours. Again, nothing fancy, but helpful. View of the Lake Union was great in the morning, but street noise from passing cars was a bit annoying at night. Breakfast was excellent. At this price range, you cannot expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Interesting Location”
Reviews.Author: tmharris65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silver Cloud Lake Union on business and found it to be exactly what I needed for my trip -- great service, large room (with fireplace), scenic view, great breakfast, free internet. My only quibble would be that the location may not be the most ideal for some travelers. I had an extra day to spend in the city after my business meetings were over. The hotel is just outside the downtown visitors district -- a quick trolley ride away (or the hotel has a shuttle). Also, I arrived late and wanted dinner, but there is no onsite restaurant. There are a few nearby, but I was not up for a 9pm (somewhat dark) walk in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: TechGuy123
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in this hotel just before the weather turned nasty and the views of Lake Union were stunning. We got the bus into King Street Station beside Quest Field and then a taxi from here to the hotel (~$15) arriving in the middle of the afternoon. Our room was spacious with two double beds, tv, desk etc, nice bathroom with additional bash basin outside the room and beautiful views from a balcony across Lake Union. In the morning we could see Sea Planes taking off from the front of the hotel and large boats coming into dock. There was an in-room fridge but no safe - but the hotel did not feel unsafe in any way. Breakfast is served until 9:30am and consists of cereal, waffles, sausages and scrambled eggs in addition to the tea, coffee and juice. The breakfast room had a nice view over the bay but it had no other purpose for the rest of the day. The hotel had no noticeable restaurant or bar, but there are several establishments across the street and heading down-town would obviously provide more options. There was a street train and a bus stop outside the door of the hotel but in my opinion the hotel is a little far out from down-town and the street train is beyond useless. Enquire at reception about their shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms, fitness room, and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Colovoyageur
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled with my two teenagers. We stayed one night and wish we could have stayed longer. Room had fantastic view of lake with seaplanes taking off and landing, yachts, rowers in the morning. Fitness room is one of the best I have seen, particularly for a medium sized hotel. Breakfast was excellent and seemed to be enjoyed by many guests. Hotel offers convenient shuttles to several of the tourist attractions. I have stayed in many hotels in Seattle, and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud Inn at Lake Union is a great place to stay while visiting Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: travelbud53
Reviews.Content: What an enjoyable stay! Silver Cloud Inn at Lake Union has an amazing staff that makes sure your stay is truly wonderful. We had a beautiful lake view room with views of the Space Needle. The hotel offers free parking in a secure garage and a convenient shuttle to Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square and the Space Needle eliminating the hassle of driving in downtown Seattle. It is also within walking distance to some very good restaurants on the lake. The rooms are spotless and the beds are very comfortable. The only thing that could be improved upon is the breakfast area. The breakfast items are adequate, but it is not clear if table cleaning is the responsibility of the guest or the staff, leaving few places to sit that are clean. I would definitely recommend staying here while in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “We were quite pleased with the Silver...”
Reviews.Author: EnviroSci
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with the Silver Cloud Lake Union. We wanted a place close to the city with free parking and breakfast. The Silver Cloud has that. The breakfast was kind of a free-for-all, with not enough bus people or servers to accommodate the crowd, but the food was ample enough. The room was nice, with fine amenities. We enjoyed the view of the seaplanes landing. We ate at Duke's Chowder House, a short walk away, and that was very good as other reviewers have noted. We would return to the Silver Cloud.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy & Fabulous breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PennyW5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed tor three nights and enjoyed our stay. Our room had a fireplace which we used each night. Free WiFi was good too. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was well kept. . My husband liked the shampoo & lotions (Aveda) Also breakfast is not to be missed with waffles, scrambled eggs & sausage with pastries galore! Nearby restaurants, Chandlers CrabHouse and Ivar's Salmon House equally delicious! Staff was especially helpful with booking free hotel shuttle service and arranging transportation tool Fresh fruit and hard candy was appreciated also at the front desk. Delightful hotel! We will return again! ,

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great for families.”
Reviews.Author: moorefamily19
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Silver Cloud. While it was a little more than we wanted to pay, the amenities -- free parking, nice breakfast included, free shuttle to major tourist attractions -- actually made it a very good value. The location on the lake is great - we could walk to beautiful parks and lots of restaurants. It was also much closer to the downtown attractions that we realized, and the shuttle made it very easy to get around without driving if you choose. Staff was very helpful and accomodating; they welcome families and made it very easy to travel with our 16-month-old (even putting a carseat in the shuttle for us to use.) The 24-hour indoor pool also came in handy with our jet-lagged son was awake and bored at 5am.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: boilerjenni
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel! The free shuttle was great - I loved being able to keep our car parked at the hotel (at no charge) and ride in the van to/from downtown. There's also easy access to I-5 if you're driving. One of the best features of the hotel was the fitness room - lots of little extras that made for a great workout. The hot tub was nice and the breakfast was fine. I would definitely stay here again. Also, there's an awesome sushi restaurant across the street called I Love Sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!!”
Reviews.Author: TariTari
Reviews.Content: Great price, Great free parking, Very accomodating staff - They allowed us check in early and jumped through hoops to see if a room was available to us!, Great room - We had a jacuzzi room and it was super!, Fantastic breakfast. - The breakfast area is the nicest "continental" breakfast area we have ever seen. It has many nooks and crannies- a library-like setting in one part, large solarium type in another, and even an outside area. The food selection was great, complete with eggs and sausage!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VT_Explorer
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Seattle in late July, early August. The Silver Cloud Inn at Lake Union is located perfectly to see the sights. They have an hourly shuttle that will pick you up and drop you off at area locations. The included breakfast is a nice touch and a bit more than your typical continental type breakfast. The rooms are clean, quiet and large. The pool is nice, but nothing too special. The only downside is that we requested a lakeside room. My suggestion is to ask for at least the 4th floor and up if you want an unrestricted view of the lake. Otherwise, you may have some trees blocking your view. Across the street there are several nice restaurants, and even a sailboat rental place. An in-house bar/restaurant is all that is missing from this hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: RSoxPhan
Reviews.Content: We had wanted to stay downtown for our 4 day trip to Seattle (to see the Red Sox) but were concerned about the price to park our rental. We chose the Silver Cloud at Lake Union because they offered free on-site parking. We were so pleased with this choice and will stay there again when we visit Seattle again. It was quiet and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We were very happy with the shuttle service that is offered and used it each day to explore the city. They got us to and from the Mariners - Red Sox games with little waiting. We were able to get there early to watch batting practice too! The parking spaces are very tiny but you can find a place to park any size car if you look around (try the 2nd floor). The area around the hotel is a mix of medical buildings and marinas and there are a few places to get something to eat or have a drink. The free breakfast was better than expected. The hotel is closer to downtown than you think and the space needle is less than a mile and a half away. If you need parking, you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: TheresaD8
Reviews.Content: There are so many pluses about this hotel: Free Parking, Free Shuttle Service, Free Breakfast, Free HBO The major minus I found was breakfast. It was crazy! The definitely need a couple more toasters. They had lots of food (eggs, sausage, bagels, toast, yogurt, pastries, waffles, juice, coffee). Very nice. It was just kind of free for all trying to get anything. People would cut in front of you. I didn't even TRY to make a waffle. There was a line of about 6 people. Also, the hotel is near I-5, and we could hear the cars going by. (It sounded as if the window wasn't closed, even though it was. I think they just need better windows.) I really can't say enough about the shuttle service. It was so convenient to get downtown and not have to worry about parking (some garages were $12/hour!) The rooms were clean and large. The free wifi was great for looking up things to do and getting directions while we were there. They also had a business center in the lobby, so we could print our boarding passes. The fitness center was also impressive. Lots of cardio and weight machines. Very nice. I would definitely stay there again if I was in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: benmacd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 5 years ago, and found the standard to be the same. The rooms are spacious, and the staff on the front desk were very friendly. They have a complimentary shuttle to the downtown area every 30 mins which was great! Our room included free wifi and a full continental breakfast. Also seemed to have good business facilities, although we did not personally use them. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views - Nice Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: nusk
Reviews.Content: Big Plusses for this Inn: 1. Good Clean Room with Super Views 2. Quiet 3. Location with Complimentary Shuttle to Pike's Market and Seattle Center 4. Good Complimentary Breakfast though a bit of a zoo the first day 5. Free Parking 6. Walk to Restaurants 7. Two sinks - one outside the BA 8. Refrigerator and Microwave Minuses: 1. Very Snow Fox News 2. Lack of TV Channel choices 3. One counter person was not very interested - everyone else was great! We would book at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: curlygirlNewYork
Reviews.Content: A little out of the way from downtown but they have free shuttles to take you there. No need to rent a car. Great view of Lake Union, about 6 good restaurants within walking distance across the street. Rooms were very clean with comfortable beds. Nice breakfast. Friendly and helpful front desk. I liked that you could open the window for fresh air. Try to get a room on the higher floors because of the busy street in front. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find!!! Utilize the shuttle!”
Reviews.Author: JardiNordby
Reviews.Content: Wow! I found this place on the internet with the help of Google Earth. We had a double queen top floor overlooking the lake. Could still see the Space Needle. But watching the sail boats and seaplanes were more enchanting than we expected or imagined. Threw the doors open in the evening and in the morning just to enjoy the atmosphere. Wonderful, huge, free breakfast with a lovely dining lobby with patio. The staff was very helpful with any question, right down to the maid service. What a great parking garage built right into the lower levels. The pool was a bit small, but perfect for the kids to play in while I read a book, relaxing after sightseeing all day. Now, THE SHUTTLE service to 3 drop off spots, was so CONVENIENT! Across the street and down a block was a great restaurant, The Blu Water Bistro, to dine outside in the warm evening, watching seaplanes and sailboats. Don't forget to sign up for Silver Cloud rewards, too. I'm definatley coming again, so I'll be racking up those rewards!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: debmac415
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for 2 nights prior to an Alaska cruise. Rooms are nicely appointed and had one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept in. It is also within walking distance of some good restaurants. We ate at Dukes Chowder house (was recommended by hotel staff as a "locals" place) and we were not disappointed. Nice breakfast buffett. Only complaint would be the staff on the night we checked in were not too friendly or welcoming. They seemed bored and fairly indifferent. After an exhausting days worth of cross country air travel , it would have been nice to have experienced a little more hospitality.There is a free hotel shuttle to Pikes Place, Space Needle, etc. and the dirver(s) were very nice and accomodating. Will definitely stay here again if we ever get back to Seattle. hope so :) What a great city.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Gringo1
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what my daughter and I needed following an extended trip through Alaska. The staff was welcoming and courteous, the lobby and rooms were impeccable, breakfast was a huge surprise with eggs, link sausage, waffles, Danish, breads, muffins, cereal, etc,, etc. The hotel was extremely quiet and the rooms could not have been more comfortable. I loved the location as it was away from the hustle and bustle of Pikes Market, etc. but their shuttle was available to whisk us there or to the SPace Needle or Pioneer Square. ONe bonus, that we didn't expect, was free washer and dryer service. How good is that? No need to find a laundry as we just walked down the hall and could relax. The little store in the lobby sold Tide, etc. Can not recommend this highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated Hotel in the heart of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: kybernetic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superbly located a few minuted on foot from downtown (ca 15-20 minutes from downtown, Pike Place Market). Make sure you spend $100 more and get a view to Lake Union. The rooms are clean and some are equipped with a gas fire place! Personnel is friendly and helpful. The 3rd floor has the breakfast room with a buffet and a wonderful view towards Lake Union and Queen Anne. For those travelling with cars: parking is free with hotel stay, and internet access is free as well. The only disadvantage is the unfortunate location between two major roads/freeways (I5), but as long as windows are closed, no problem. Otherwise: Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Wish there were more hotels like this one!”
Reviews.Author: Momago1
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! Checking in was easy. Friendly and helpful staff. Very clean hotel. Rooms were average size but very nicely done. Bathroom was a little small. We travelled with our two teenagers and loved the free breakfast. Scrambled eggs, sausage, make your own waffles, yogurt, fruit, cereal, muffins, coffee tea milk juices. Breakfast room was very nice! Be sure to get there early as it does fill up and they run out of plates so you may have to wait for clean ones. The indoor pool and hot tub is nice. There are laundry rooms in the hotel. Free parking is a major plus. Free shuttle to 3 different locations around the city. Be sure to put your name down to reserve a spot in the shuttle. We made the mistake of just going to the lobby without making a call first to reserve and had to wait for one hour. Apples, tea and coffee are always available in the lobby and on the 3rd floor in the breakfast room. This hotel is about 5-10 minutes from the space needle. We could see it from a hotel room. Very lovely views from our room on the 7th floor. Price was 179.00

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Madowa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in July in a family suite on the top floor. Excellent view of Lake Union and the Space needle. We got lucky with the weather so it was an absolute delight watching the yachts and seaplanes in the afternoon as the sun set. Handy location when travelling by car with free parking. Parking on the second floor is not as tight as on the first floor. Our Suburban was no troubles at all. The value was outstanding given the room size. The suite we booked had a king bed that could be separated from the living area with a comfortable fold out queen size sofa bed (no complaints from the kids) Breakfast was included and actually much better than most complimentary breakfasts (like Holiday Inn, Comfort Inn etc) but be early as it get very busy by about 7.30am and there is a scramble for tables and cutlery/plates (though the staff are never far away to replace them). Very available shuttle, which again is complimentary, will get you to the downtown tourist destinations and also pick you up. Also with the kids it was nice to walk across the road to the marina where there were a couple of parks with play equimpent amongst a reasonable selection of restaurants. Great spot to base yourself for seattle and daytrips out to the mountains and Olympic Peninsula. In summary a fantastic hotel and although we only planned 3 night there we stayed a full week...

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Seattle---great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbadmom4
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days here with my daughter, grad student at UW. Great location away from the downtown hustle and bustle. Took the light rail from the airport, then the streetcar about a block from the hotel. Lovely room facing the lake. Busy street but kept the a/c fan on all night, and we slept fine. Excellent bkft. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Average”
Reviews.Author: SojournSister
Reviews.Content: This hotel does provide a good $ value for those who need (esp families with children), including free parking and breakfast included. The breakfast itself was decent with scrambled eggs, sausage, and bagels/toast. You can even make your own waffles. Personally, I was disappointed. It was the hotel I liked the least during our trip to Vancouver-Victoria-Whistler-then Seattle. There is a view of the lake, but not a great one since it was not "picture quality". The location was not central enough for my taste – could not simply walk out the door and be in the central part of town within a block or two (close to shopping and great restaurants. A shuttle was needed into town, which the hotel does provide for free (every 30 mins). Another inconvenience for us was the lack of an onsite restaurant; important for any hotel not within walking distance of good restaurants. The room also had "tired' decor. The toilet and shower were in a separate small room, but the sink and cabinets were in the hallway of the room right by the door. NOTE: The hotel is NOT right on the water. There is a highway and docks inbetween your view. All in all...if you are traveling without children (just you and spouse)...and if you enjoy staying in a central location where you can get out and walk for exercise, with shopping and good restaurants close by...this is not the place for you. I recommend spending a bit more money and staying closer in town - something I wish we had done. On the other hand, this is a very good value for Seattle for those on a more limited budget or those with children/families.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome View for Fourth of July Celebration”
Reviews.Author: TravelDetailsbySJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Seattle, Washington this past Fourth of July and stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn on Lake Union. We had a birdseye view of the celebration. With the boats and yachts on Lake Union as a backdrop, the scene was breathtaking. The Silver Cloud Inn on Lake Union is conveniently located in an area where there are lots of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. So you can choose to go out for dinner and drinks before the start of the celebration. Safe and clean surroundings allow for a leisurely walk after the fireworks display. As an added charm, the hotel served a full complimentary breakfast buffet the next morning!

Reviews.Title: “Central location with a great view if you pay extra for lakeview.”
Reviews.Author: matt5217
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel with a spectacular lake view, free parking, Wifi, and breakfast in a major city is a coup. This place has all of those in a nice central location. Easy to get to the sights downtown, out to Freemont or other cool neighborhoods, and onto the highway to explore beyond the city. The staff was most helpful and friendly with our requests to drop the bags before our check-in, and to hold them on our last day in town so they wouldn't be visible in the car as we had a late night flight home. There probably was easy access to public transit, although we didn't use it. My only complaint was that the walking around the lake area in this part of town wasn't quite as peaceful as I would have liked or expected from looking at maps and the hotel's website. But much of that is out of their control. I would certainly stay here again the next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families”
Reviews.Author: betjam
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, good service, polite staff. Shuttle is great, if you can get on--very busy when popular teams in town. Breakfast--hire some more staff, those ladies were running like crazy, never lost their smiles though. Too many people and not enough food. Bad coffee, Especially in lobby, which should not happen in Seattle. Good Thai place up the road. Pool was okay, we went every day.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Seattle Base in Scenic Area with Public Transportation”
Reviews.Author: Two-For-Texas
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a motel in Seattle that would be in a convenient location for sightseeing, on a public transit line to avoid need to drive downtown, offer free parking, be near a lot of things to do and be affordable. We found the Silver Cloud Inn - Lake Union thanks to all the reviews on Trip Advisor. We stayed three nights and loved it there. There was a good selection of restaurants in walking distance and we found ourselves pleased with the seafood and chowder at Duke's Chowder House. In fact, we did not even have to use our rental car from the time we checked in to the time we checked out. We could walk a short way to the streetcar which whisked us downtown within a short walk of the Pikes Place Market, Pioneer Square, the ferry docks, the monorail and much more. Seattle is a very big and spread out place with a lot to do. The Inn let us get a feel of life in Seattle as an urban dweller. We shall have to return and spend more time and we will use this inn. The room was comfortable, hot coffee in lobby upon arrival, nice breakfast in an excellent dining area with a view over Lake Union. We could walk along the piers and sidewalks by the lake just across the street from the inn. The Center for Wooden Boats - a wonderful place to see - was a 10 minute walk by the water. All in all we had a great time. The staff was helpful. The check in process was fast. The inn met our needs. And, when we departed for Port Edmunds we were already North of Seattle so that was easy. There are a lot of walking trails and parks within a same day's driving distance to the North and East.

Reviews.Title: “Location: close enough to tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: stpauliewoman
Reviews.Content: Best parts: nice views of lake Union, good staff, free shuttle leaving every 1/2 hour to Pikes place and Space needle which makes tourist spots easy to get to while avoiding costly downtown hotels and parking. free parking good security. reasonable rates. Can walk across street to a couple of good places to eat. Complimentary breakfast is nice and served in a neat area with big windows and view of lake. Downside:would not go here if you are expecting to spend a lot of time in a pool. there is a pool but it is only adequate

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: CalifoniaMO4
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in Seattle with my two daughters, 16 and 22. We loved the location of the Silver Cloud Inn and our room had a great view of Lake Union. We used the free shuttle every day and enjoyed the free breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Seattle”
Reviews.Author: sjanes
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and yes it is a bit outside the city centre. The hotel has a free shuttle and we used that as well as public transport and walking and didn't find it any problem. The secure parking was free which you don't find in the city centre and with breakfast, internet and laundry all included it was a good deal for a fairly pricey city. We did have a bit of street noise but our room was clean and comfortable and I would stay here again if I return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: texiss
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a great hotel! Large room with micro & fridge, super-comfy beds, lots of extra pillows, 24-hour store, free shuttle to major attractions, free covered parking, more-than-adequate free breakfast (pastries, waffles, boiled eggs, juices, cereals, toast, cheese), and wonderful view of Lake Union. Quiet location. Restaurants within 5-minute walk. We splurged a little bit to stay in a room with a view of the lake, and were happy we did so. A nice surprise...the window opened! It was cool to watch the float planes landing & taking off. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “a great, practical choice, just book it!:)”
Reviews.Author: adventurerKelowna
Reviews.Content: I only have praise for this hotel! Great service - from maids to desk clerks to shuttle drivers. Very clean hotel, great breakfast, fantastic equipped clean gym, Aveda in the rooms! Being a little out of downtown was not an issue at all with the shuttle - they even took us to safeco field! And free parking:)

Reviews.Title: “Everyone must stay here before they cruise to Alaska”
Reviews.Author: Sharon4311
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Seattle on May 17 to Cruise out on May 18 to Alaska on The Carnival Spirit. I researched where to stay and looked up various hotels listed on various sites. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. The entire staff was outstanding. My uncle parked his car in the free parking deck when we arrived and the free hotel shuttle took us where ever we wanted to go on Monday afternoon. The staff recommended places to visit and restaurants with the best food. We were given a card with the Courtesy Shuttle phone number on it and all you had to do was call and you would be picked up and taken to another attraction. The room was very spacious and clean. Very quite and sleep quality was excellent. This hotel would be my first pick next time I visit Seattle. I would recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: kidtripping
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last night on a family trip to the Seattle Zoo. There were four of us two adults, a 4 year old and a 1 year old. Booked a double queen room. This room had plenty of space to set up the crib and still move around. The room was very clean, mini fridge to hold juice and bottles. On arrival the desk staff was very helpful in helping us find a restaurant. When we were about to leave and walk there the shuttle driver offered us a lift. The breakfast is great. Waffles, Yoghurt, cereal, cheese, juice, coffee. The whole family was stuffed. While this hotel is not right in the core of the city this is off-set and more by the free parking, good breakfast, and great rates. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tennesseemn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Silver Cloud Lake Union two days prior to our cruise and one day after the cruise. The hotel was very clean, and the beds where very comfortable. The staff was very kind and helped us many times in deciding where to grab a bit to eat. The free shuttle service saved us some cash and the drivers where great. They where always on time at the locations to pick us up. I would highly recommend this hotel to any one. O ya and the price was great also. What a great location by lake Union. Very nice watching the sail boats on the Lake. The 24 hour pool and hot tub is a plus. and the free parking is great. The fire place in the room was very romantic. This hotel will be on our list when we visit Seattle. Good Job!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: NCTravelers90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn on a Saturday night and were very impressed with the cleanliness, service and quality of the room. Our accomodations overlooked Lake Union where we watched float planes take off and others boating. Restaurants are near as is Starbucks! I highly recommend the king suite especially if you're staying a few days. We will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need and want served up with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: LLouise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn while we were in Seattle for a wedding. It had everything we needed and more. Free internet access in every room, flat screen tv's, continental breakfast every day, free secure parking, free shuttle service to area attractions, pool, gym, and comfortable clean rooms. Everyone who worked at the hotel was friendly and helpful. The rooms were quiet, comfortable, clean, and spacious. The lake views were fantastic--you could see boats on the lake and the Space Needle. Several hours after we checked out our son realized he had left an expensive ring on the nightstand, we called the hotel and they called us back in less than an hour to tell us they had found it. So not only are the employees friendly and helpful, they are very honest too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area. It was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CycloneJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in late April. 7th floor, non-lake front view. Room was what you expected, overlooked the busy street below. Could use a noisier air conditioning/heating unit to drown out the noise. Next time, I will pay a little more for the lake view. More than anything, great value for type of room and location. Central to many different areas and easily accessible by car. The free parking was awesome and saved another $30 per night compared to other hotels. Nice, small business center with free internet access- thank you. Great restaurants close by: Blu Water bistro, Duke's Chowder House and Chandler's. Our favorites were Duke's and Blu Water. Free shuttle to Space Needle and Pike Place Market. We used it a couple times. Driver was not very friendly or helpful (seemed bored with his job) so we started driving places and found Seattle to be very car friendly to our surprise. Would stay again but would get a ake front room and bring a fan for noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: pjtravellots
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, love love love the free parking, free internet, free breakfast, free laundry wow I've never seen free laundry before very cool. Can't you tell I love free stuff!! Fitness facilities way better than I've ever seen before too plus a pool. Breakfast was nice. Big, very clean, room with fridge and microwave. Overall great great place and I would totally stay there again and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “It was a horrible stay- for US”
Reviews.Author: ironbar
Reviews.Content: I will re-state up front that this hotel was a horrible experience- for us. I think other people would be happy with it. Anyway, here's why it was a nightmare for me and my family. We stayed in a king suite with a view over Lake Union. The room was very clean, spacious, and quiet, That's the good. Now here's the bad. Internet wi/fi- sketchy during the day. Sheets. Is there a written or unwritten rule in the hotel industry that states all sheets must be stiff and scratchy? I think there is. This hotel is no exception. My daughter ended up sleeping with the blanket next to her and the sheet on top. Bed. Is there also a written or unwrotten rule in the hotel industry that states all hotel beds must be stiff as a [---] board? This hotel is no exception. Hide-a-bed. Typical bar-in-your-back variety. Refrigerator. The fridge in the room was barely cold at all. Environment. It is mid March.. The temperature outside dips in to the 40's at night. So will someone please tell me why the hell I have to run the NOISY air conditioning at full tilt to keep the temperature DOWN in the room?? And while we're at it, can someone please explain the mysterious invisible barrier that prevents the cool air from passing from the living area into the bed area? Living area is colder than the refrigerator, while the bed area is roasting. WTH??? Needless to say we literally got no sleep tonight (I'm posting in real time from the room on 3/22/10). We were supposed to stay here for two nights but there's no way I'm going through this uncomfortable nightmare again. My wife is upset, I'm upset, and my daughter is cranky as hell this morning.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud Delivers Comfort & View”
Reviews.Author: crescentdave
Reviews.Content: We like staying here. The service has been very consistent, the rooms are admirably maintained ... it's quite efficient, but has a low key vibe. The views are outstanding ... and the location is perfect for taking short jaunts downtown, to the University, Fremont or Ballard Districts. It's just a dependably nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommend (perfect for family!)”
Reviews.Author: mintmocha
Reviews.Content: stayed with my husband and 2 kids at the Silver Cloud Inn, Lake Union in Seattle and had an wonderful stay. The deluxe suite was perfect for my family of 4 (2 kids and husband) as there was privacy in the large, efficiently priced suite, pool for the kids, free breakfast, free parking, and the dividing door between the kids space (pull out couch to comfy queen bed) and my room with my husband was perfect. Great Lake Union view from our room and directly across the street from a variety of restaurants. We chose Duke's Chowder house as there was a great choice for the kids and us adults. I highly recommend this hotel. It's not downtown but mins by the free shuttle, or by car and with the wonderful lake view and awesome price point and comfortable, clean accomodation you can't beat it!!!! If you're visiting Seattle, simply choose this hotel. I esp. appreciated Lashonna's expertise in helping us with our reservation and answering our questions about the area and helping me to find the best place to celebrate our weekend in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: likeslocalstuff
Reviews.Content: Clean, decorated in modern colors, right across from the lake. Quiet for the most part even tho it was New Years Eve. Free breakfast and indoor garage parking is inexpensive with in and out privileges. Wifi is fast and comes with. It's in an area that you need to pay attention to with directions as the streets change names and there are one ways and two ways and forced turns etc. Has a gas fireplace in the room. Room was roomy. Front desk was accomodating. Indoor pool and hot tub 24 hours. Not too far from downtown. It's a chain so mostly predictable. Safe area. I personally like locally owned, one of a kind hotels better but that's just me.

Reviews.Title: “great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Isis30Ca
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel throught Hotwire, so we didn't know what to expect prior to the payment. It was once again a very good experiences while traveling within US. We got at the hotel pretty late in the evenin, but the staff was very helpful and once we settled in we really loved it! Very clean, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay Before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: ppraisegod
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reviews on a cruise site. The staff was amazing and they have a shuttle to the local shops. Seeing the fish market is something! We were told ahead of time they had a shuttle to the cruise ship dock but when we arrived they said they didn't do it anymore.They did it for us anyway..... Driver could not have been nicer. Breakfast was great. Hotel very nice. Only negitive was hotel is a on a very noisey street and room 302 faces the street . Avoid this room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value....but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeetBelow
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I traveled there for a getaway weekend and stayed 2 nights. I found the room to be reasonably clean and they had Aveda complimentary shampoo (nice touch). The common areas around the lobby appeared to be clean and well kept. My girlfriend had stayed at Silver Cloud hotels and she loved the breakfast waffles they serve. The breakfast was reasonable and the waffles were great. I must add that one night we had gotten a bit lost late at night. I called for the shuttle. Although we were not in an area where the shuttle normally picks up, the hotel manager made an exception and had the shuttle pick us up. File that under "good customer service". I travel for business about 100 nights a year and I found this hotel to be a nice value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: EagleOne_TheRaven
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud rooms were comfortable. Our Crockery in one of our rooms had lipstick on it! The free wireless internet was ridiculously slow. The hotel is not central to anything for tourists, but they did provide a free shuttle, which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a few extra $$ for the Marriott Residence Inn instead!”
Reviews.Author: ahloofu
Reviews.Content: We visit the Lake Union area about 4 times a year and have split our stays between the Silver Cloud and the Marriott Residence. Usually we let either Hotwire or Priceline decide for us which one we're to stay at :) Hands down...our experience at the Marriott is far superior than the Silver Cloud even though they are similar in rank. While both rooms/suites are very comfortable, updated and clean...the pool at the Silver Cloud is awful and has not been cleaned for what seems like years. We decided to spend a quite evening in the pool and even though our eyes were opened under water...we couldn't see more than foot in front of us! The water was incredibly dirty which was such a disappointment especially because it is opened 24hrs...very rare for most hotels. The lobby is very understated and the service is nice, but quiet. We found the service and atmosphere of the Marriott much more welcoming and front desk seemed more eager to help. What really makes the Marriott worthwhile over the Silver Cloud is their continental breakfast. Hands down, the best breakfast you will have in a long time...and for free! From sausages to yogurt...to eggs, bagels, fresh waffles! Unbelievable and will someone staffed to clean your table/plate as soon as you're done. One perk of the Silver Cloud is the free overnight parking! Otherwise, spend the extra few dollars and choose the Marriott instead!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: glstraveling
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - it's a great price for the city. The free shuttle to downtown hot spots (plus free parking) was invaluable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 3 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: datcabin
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this same hotel in August 2009, and really liked all it offered. Short distance to UW, free shuttle service downtown, free secure covered parking, swimming pool, workout area, free basic breakfast with a view of the lake and convenient use of the inhouse computers. The front desk staff were very helpful and the shuttle drivers went beyond what we expected. So when I came back out in September to visit my daughter at UW, I stayed at the same place. This time I booked a King bed and requested a fireplace if available. I called in Monday when my flight landed to see if I could arrive early. It was several hours before check-in time, and the room was not available yet. However they said I could check back in a couple hours. In the end it was late afternoon before I made it to the hotel. I was so delighted with the room! A side view of the lake/harbor and a fireplace with a mini bar and King bed. My daughter came by and said WOW ! What a room! It was wonderful to be able to relax there during my visit. And the room was clean! Thanks for making my stay so nice!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay in Seattle at the Silver Cloud Lake Union”
Reviews.Author: Jeffberk81
Reviews.Content: Recently had the pleasure of staying 4 nights at the Silver Cloud Lake Union. This was after reading many reviews on here. As many have stated previously, the shuttle is great, the breakfast buffet while not overwhelming was certainly adequate and the overall service was good. The shuttle has 3 drop off points at various parts of the city and with a phone call they will come and pick you up and give an estimate on how long it will be. Never did we have to wait more than 15 minutes. This was with a very busy weekend in the city as many Southern Cal fans were in town, Microsoft had a convention and the Yankees were in town to play the M's. Anyway, the breakfast buffet offered self made fresh waffles, various breads, muffins, cereal, fruit, juices, coffee and tea. Our room was a lake view suite which was great. King size bed was very comfortable, A washer and dryer are available on each floor for free. TV's were better than most. Parking was safe and free. Internet available in the lobby for free which was nice. Never had to wait, also access in rooms. Overall, I am happy that I chose the Silver Cloud Lake Union and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, GREAT EXTRAS!”
Reviews.Author: RecentlyRetired08
Reviews.Content: This Silver Cloud, was right across the street from the Union Lake. Sail boats and various yachts, The hotel didn't have a restaurant but did serve a FREE continental breakfast everyday. Hotel guest had FREE parking which was also very secure. The hotel also had a FREE shuttle to various points in the city, including SafeCo Field. After being nickle and dime to death on this vacation this hotel was one of the safe havens from hidden or extra charges. HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: spikeboy
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. Rooms clean & comfortable beds. We stayed 4 days & then went to Whistler & Victoria & back to Silver Cloud. We stayed in 343 the first time & when we came back we stayed in 743. The room had 2 queens, fridg, microwave, free wifi, near the elevators & ice machine. It also had a washer & dryer. the staff are outstanding. There are restaurants within walking distance. We tried the sushi restaurant outstanding. The rates were very good. Shuttle is great. Transportation is free certain time of the day. It is a real find. Would stay there again. Brekfast was very good. Margaret Va Beach VA

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: deepthinker
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rates and lots of room. My son had friends in to visit, and it was great having a separate room and second tv so adults and kids could all be entertained after we'd finished swimming in the pool. Staff was very friendly even though there were so many of us trooping through the lobby to the pool and back. We found free parking on the street nearby, although it was only free because it was a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BritBorn
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel as it is close to where our son and daughter-in-law live. We did not pay for a view room, but our room looked to the back side with a street view and was not bad at all. The room was very nice, clean and well-appointed. My husband got good use of the internet while waiting for me to get ready in the morning. I loved the Aveda products in the bathroom and the hair dryer was of good quality which many times it isn't. The breakfast room was gorgeous with the outside seating area and view of Lake Union. I cannot eat any wheat/bread products and was glad to see choices of hard boiled eggs and yogurt in their continental breakfast. We were not there on a Tuesday evening to comment on the wine & cheese reception. We also didn't get time for the fitness room or pool area, but they looked nice. I liked the security of the gated parking lot and that it was free. And how nice it was to stay in a completely smoke-free hotel -- ahhhh! We have already recommended this place to our daughter-in-law's parents and plan to stay here again the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed and expected”
Reviews.Author: 2009Visitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in early August. The shuttle was perfect for what we needed and easy to arrange. The shuttle drivers were all helpful with info for our first trip to Seattle. The secured, FREE, parking was unheard of elsewhere. My teens enjoyed the pool, breakfast and even used the fitness room. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We had a room on the 6th floor and noticed the elevators were slow. Otherwise a perfect stay for a good price in comparison to others with similar amenities. I have already recommended to others.

Reviews.Title: “Complete package”
Reviews.Author: tahiti_ldy
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a girl's weekend and it was exactly what we needed---a place in a great location to rest up, comfortable room/bed, and friendly service. The shuttle is fantastic. There are 3 drop off/pick up spots: Pike's Place (1st Street & Pine @ Simple Seattle coffee shop), Pioneer Square (it's right where the underground tour begins) and the Space Needle. The shuttle is free and we had no problem getting on a shuttle at the last minute...never had to pre-reserve. Be sure to ask the driver for a map of sites. Parking is free which awesome since hourly parking even near the hotel runs about $2/hr. We never had a problem finding parking even at 10pm. That combined with the shuttle just made it so easy to get to the main attractions in Seattle hassle free. Our plane didn't leave till 9pm but the hotel let us leave our car parked there as well as continue to use their shuttle service free of charge which was really nice. The hotel has a few restaurants nearby but we always ate downtown or in the U-District which is only a 5 minute drive from the hotel. Breakfast was great: Boiled eggs, oatmeal, yogurt, at least 3 different kinds of muffins, jellied pastries, coffee, juice, waffles and cereal. The breakfast area is wonderful and has a nice outdoor balcony to sit at. Hot tub was great to soaking in after walking around downtown....a little potent on the chlorine but opening up a few of their windows would help that. We booked a 2 queen beds room, non-lake view and were given a great room, with 2 windows, and a french door mini-balcony... the thing that didn't make it a lake view was the fact that there was a huge spruce tree blocking the way and we were only on the 3rd floor. Beds were superbly comfortable. Room was well sized as was the bathroom. Aveda bath products, mini-fridge and microwave and 42" tv. The business center has 2 computers and we never had to wait to use one. You can print off anything, no charge. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Traipser_OR
Reviews.Content: Not outstandingly good or bad. Friendly, efficient staff. Comfortable room. Breakfast was adequate but not memorable. Free parking!. If paying for "Lake View" room it would be better to get oneabove fourth floor to avoid obstructed view.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: behappy88
Reviews.Content: I was terribly disappointed with this hotel, from the moment we checked-in, it was obvious the front desk staff was overwhelmed by the fact they were fully booked and was not able to cope, and one particular employee could not conceal it, very unprofessional in her people skills. My family came to Seattle to meet friends from Oregon to spend the weekend to watch 2 nights of baseball at Safeco Field. Our friends arrived before us, they called the front desk to find out if we had checked-in, as they booked reservations on the shuttle to take us to the baseball game, and would cancel the shuttle as a courtesy for other guests to use if we had not arrived, they were told by front desk we had not checked-in, so based on that, they released the shuttle reservations. Meanwhile we were already checked-in as we saw our friends in the lobby within minutes of their conversation with the front desk, interestingly it was the same staff member who checked us in that advised them we had not. When we went to inquire with the reservation desk to see if there was any chance to still get on the shuttle, we were told reservations were already given to someone else and the shuttle was full. However, when we asked the shuttle driver, we found out the shuttle was not full and there was indeed enough seats for our party. The shuttle does not take you to the downtown area of Seattle where the department stores and shopping is located, so we took the street car about a block and 1/2 away. We discovered the street car ourselves, as the staff at the hotel didn't advise us of this, we were told to walk 3 blocks for a city bus. I really felt any time we asked the front desk a question, we were putting them out, of course we asked the same staff member every time we had a question. We were really kind and gentle in our delivery when speaking with this particular front desk employee and in no way came across demanding, and yet her mannerisms and facial expressions let us know we were a bother. Room size decent, but not large like some reviews mentioned. You better get into the free continental breakfast at least 15 minutes before closing, as they are packing up right in front and around you, even seeing there is still a stream of people waiting in line for toast and the waffle maker, however if you miss it, no great lost, as it's marginal at best. Our family travels a lot on weekends for sports tournaments and leisure, this is our 7th hotel stay in the past 14 weeks, and our only dismal hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, would recommend. excellent service/facility overcame slightly out of 'main' area location.”
Reviews.Author: Cads_ap
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights with young family. rooms good size with all facilities expected. good and helpful email communication from staff prior to arrival. hotel offered free coffee all day long. complementary breakfast was fabulous; very useful, especially when not want to take kids wandering in new city looking for food. also offered free shuttle buses and pick ups down town. hotel was great. free internet and business centre. slightly out of town but shuttle buses made up for it. would recommend. seattle was fabulous and to get to airport and back, would recommend the shuttleexpress.com buses. reliable, reasonable and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Rainbowman-Hawaii
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the lake-view room that we reserved. The room was clean, spacious, and in good condition. It was nice to wake up and look out onto Lake Union as it was bustling with a variety of watercraft on a sunny summer day. You can hear the faint drone of float planes taking off from the water, but wasn't loud enough to wake us up in the morning. Breakfast on Sunday was a zoo! The food was decent (waffles, cereal, pastries), but the staff couldn't keep up with the crush of people, so we had to wait for them to wash dishes and refill items (this is why I dropped them a notch on 'hotel service'). Monday's breakfast was much less crowded and everything was well stocked. The dining area is pleasant and has a nice view. Free parking is a real plus, although we had to park in the overflow parking across the street since their parking lot was full on Saturday. Two free internet terminals in the business center was helpful. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel not too far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Smiths
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days in July to do some sightseeing. The hotel is across the street from Lake Union within walking distance of restaurants (Duke's Chowderhouse was excellent). There is a free shuttle between the hotel and 3 of the downtown sights (Pioneer Square, Pike's Place Market, Space Needle). We took the shuttle to Pioneer Square (recommend the Underground Tour and area bookstores) and over the course of the day walked to the other two, then decided it wasn't that much farther to walk back to the hotel. We spent a little extra to get a jacuzzi room which still seemed like a good deal for a hotel that close to downtown. Parking in a locked garage was free. Free parking appeared to be a rarity anywhere we went in the city, so a definite bonus. The room was nice and we could see the Space Needle and Lake Union from our window. We didn't try out the free guest laundromats, but it seemed like a nice amenity. The complimentary breakfast was decent with better than average pastries, make your own waffles, hard boiled eggs, cheese, and all the usual breads and cereals. Overall, it seemed like a good value that was close enough to the downtown sights, while having some interesting things to see close by (Center for Wooden Boats) . Public transportation was close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hiddent gem, great location”
Reviews.Author: ABH2
Reviews.Content: We had a room facing the Lake, and it was a joy watching the sea planes take off and land on the Lake! Wonderful ambiance, and we could see the Space Needle, too!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience and My Kids LOVED It!”
Reviews.Author: happylodger
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times with my family of five. My kids love the nice warm pool, the waffles for breakfast, and watching the sea planes come and go. I love the clean rooms, helpful staff, secure parking, and proximity to restaurants, docks/boats, and a play structure (all just a few minutes walk from the hotel). Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay On The 3rd Floor”
Reviews.Author: NE007
Reviews.Content: This isa beautiful hotel on Lake Union. Very attentive staff. Offers a shuttle to see the sights. However, we stayed on the 3rd floor which is street level on the back of the hotel. Traffic noise, truck unloading on their dock and this is also the level the hotel serves complimentary breakfast in the dining area. The staff starts preparations about 5:30 AM and the noise carries all over 3rd floor. So, I would highly recommend, but not 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: forrestd
Reviews.Content: We were on way back from Canada, and going to a Baseball game at Safeco Field, this is ideally located just off the I5, also being slightly out of down town the rates were much more reasonable. The Hotel overlooks Lake Union, our room being on the 6th floor, you could watch seaplanes taking off and landing, and the general bustle of the boats on the water made it a very pleasant place in which to stay. The hotel is spacious and modern, we had a deluxe water view room and it was great. The best things about the hotel are the free parking (so you can park and forget about it), the complimentary breakfasts and coffee and tea points around the hotel, the free Internet access with printers, and best of all, the complimentary shuttle to the down town area. It will drop you off at the Space Needle, Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square, and because there were ball games on, by Qwest Field. It picks up till about 10.30pm. We came out of Safeco Field and just rang the front desk, it came in about 15 minutes. It's great, no need to worry about trying to park or fight your way through the horrendous traffic. If we ever go back to Seattle, this place will be were we will stop.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel- great shuttle- no need to rent a car!”
Reviews.Author: leenb
Reviews.Content: Booked the Silver Cloud at Lake Union after reading other reviews. Got a super saver rate online, found the hotel to be quiet and pleasant. Room was clean, nice Aveno products, firm beds. Nice computer center. Staff helpful and friendly- Breakfast on the third floor provided the usual fare but with a nice waterfront view. Best of all was the free Shuttle. It dropped off and picked up near Pikes Market, Space Needle and Pioneer Village. Pick up within 10-15 minutes. Unsure how much to tip the driver, but did so at regular intervals as driver provided tourist info, history and suggestions for restaurants and shops. Got to use the shuttle for six hours after check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Silver Cloud Inn Lake Union”
Reviews.Author: bwh29
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just came back from a 3 night stay at the Silver Cloud Inn Lake Union. The room was large, very clean, with comfortable beds and a terrific 42" flat screen TV. The lake view was great with landing sea plans, sail boats and even the Seattle Space Needle. All the staff were wonderfully accomodating and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was just the right touch to start the day. The complimentary parking was definitely a plus. We would love to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud Inn-Lake Union has many good amenities”
Reviews.Author: kennygHonolulu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sliver Cloud Inn-Lake Union for 6 nights basically to attend our daughter's graduate school commencement @ UW & to spend some time with both the daughter and son who is attending the AI school @ Seattle. Traveling to Seattle from Hawaii and arriving at the hotel at midnight was an adventure-we drove from the SeaTac airport with all of the construction barriers along the I-5 made our drive to the hotel a very "hairy experience". Luck was on our side and once we spotted the Seattle downtown highrise lights, we knew we were on the right direction. Our check in was a breeze so after our long flight and finally finding our hotel, we had a very comfortable sleep on soft beds. The secure hotel parking was free so it's a big plus in a town that usually charge for parking and the hotel provides a pretty good continential breakfast which we enjoyed every morning. Our room was clean and comfortable and it had all of the comforts of home- a microwave oven, a mini-refrig, a bar sink, free internent access, a 40" flat screen tv and a free washer/dryer unit on every floor. There is an exercise workout room & a heated swimming pool for the workout folks and the hotel provides a free shuttle bus ride to downtown. There is a computer room which provides free internet and there are even printers to run your print outs. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The only drawbacks are that there is no hotel restaurant on site so the guests will have to patronize the neighboring restaurants which were a bit pricy for us-most of our lunches & dinners were elsewhere. The other drawback, if you're the type who is use to in taking the hotel elevator on the lobby floor is that this hotel is designed for the guests to go out throught a door next to the front desk, pass the hotel parking driveway and enter through a secure door to the hotel elevators which I thought was pretty weird. Check out was fast & simple and if you like to stay in a small local hotel which is located in a very quiet neighborhood (Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center is next door) and has many good hotel amenities right the the mid-point of downtown Seattle and the University of Washington campus, the Silver Cloud Inn @ Lake Union is highly recommended from this Hawaiian couple.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary hotel, weird mattresses”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom02
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 2 nights, and we actually booked the stay based on the positive reviews from TripAdvisor. Although there was nothing specifically wrong with the hotel, it was very average. The breakfast (free) was the usual continental style with a waffle maker that my kids liked. The pastries were a bit nicer than the usual.The breakfast room was attractive. We did use the pool and spa and area was nice. The room was slightly larger than average (2 queens and a small sofabed). The mattresses were not firm, which was OK but when you moved, the whole mattress shook. Everytime my husband moved or rolled over it felt like I was sleeping on Jello. The room was clean, but the carpet was stained. Parking was included with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: hick50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend after our Alaskan cruise. Room was large and very comfortable ,nice flat screened TV, Aveeda toiletries (yeah!). The breakfast room was very nice and the selection of breakfast items was pretty impressive. Front desk personnel were very helpful. The hotel shuttle was fantastic, they will drop you off in any of 3 different sections of town (Space Needle,downtown,or Pioneer Square ),you call them when you are ready to go back to the hotel. The service runs from early morning until around 10 or 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: kimba66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 12 year old son in order to visit family in Seattle. This hotel was recommended to me by my sister who lives in Seattle and it was absolutely perfect for our needs. One of the main benefits was the free parking - I hadn't been to Seattle in a long time but found the parking in the centre to be quite expensive and a bit of a hassle; the hotel shuttle service was absolutely fantastic. They dropped us off exactly where we wanted to go and with a phone call back to the hotel they would pick us up pretty much wherever we were. The shuttle drivers were also great as ad hoc tour guides! The room was excellent -- large, comfortable and absolutely pristine in terms of cleanliness. They did not tend to replace the toiletries unless I asked (we stayed for nearly a week so we had used them up well before the end of our stay) but when asked they would supply whatever you asked, no hassle. The view of Lake Union was great - at first when you get there it seems a bit odd, the place looks like a soulless anodyne apartment block and you are just looking onto some yacht repair yard over the road but in fact the view at night is fantastic, and during the day seeing the seaplanes take off and land is quite something. I would recommend booking a 'view' room to that end. There are a few nice restaurants over the road, a sushi place which I did not try, and a bit further down a couple of really nice seafood places. I think we went to Chandlers Quay or something like that? It was very nice. Also, rather bizarrely, a Hooters, which I did not try, thought I had an interesting time explaining the whole concept of said establishment to my son. The breakfast was just OK, I did notice that the fresh fruit seemed to go early on (I was jet-lagged the whole time so saw the very early shift as well as later on) without being replenished, and you were left with the usual carb-heavy choices of make-your-own waffles, english muffins, toast, etc as well as cereals. The juice was good. Coffee and tea available all the time and the use of the pool and fitness suite was very good. There is a business centre so you can use the internet freely and this includes use of a printer which was handy for printing directions, airline boarding cards, etc. I think this may be fairly standard in American hotels but coming from Europe this seemed very civilized indeed! All in all, this is a great place to stay which is away from the centre of Seattle but still near enough to be handy for all the sights you would want to see, particularly with the use of the free shuttle service. Anyone with kids should go to the REI store a few minutes drive away for the fantastic climbing wall, they do taster climbs for very little money and the staff are so friendly and enthusiastic. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “convenient and a good value”
Reviews.Author: mfwspr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights with my girlfriend and we had a very pleasant stay. The room was quiet and clean. The free continental breakfast was pretty good and the views from the breakfast room looking over lake union were nice. We easily found a table each morning. I was able to priceline the hotel and got it for <$90 per night so we really liked the value. We used the metro bus system to get around the city and there is a bus stop directly across the street from the hotel with lines that take you into downtown. Overall a nice hotel in a convenient location with easy access to downtown without the bustle of being downtown. FREE PARKING!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not impressed”
Reviews.Author: andytina-wong
Reviews.Content: A small hotel but it is priced reasonable. the location is steps away from the waterfront of lake union. it has shuttle service to downtown. the room size is large. Cons: not much facility. do not provide you all bath supply, you need to buy it from its mini gift shop!!

Reviews.Title: “Overcomes non-central location to be a real contender!”
Reviews.Author: Kris_K_D
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud Inn - Lake Union is a fantastic place for a Seattle stay. Although not centrally located for the primary sights, the inn is close to the Fairview & Campus Drive stop of the Seattle Streetcar. For $1.75 (or $.50 for seniors, children or the disabled), you can ride the streetcar into downtown Seattle and a single ticket is valid for 2 hours. The inn makes up for its non-central location by offering guests free breakfast (a delightful assortment of goodies), a free evening reception (including wine, beer or non-alcoholic beverages), complimentary laundry facilities, a pool, and FREE parking in the hotel garage! To top it off, the facility is clean and the staff is helpful and attentive -- and great rates are to be had. So, if you're up for a little Seattle exploration by foot, then the Silver Cloud Inn is a definite find! By comparison, I've stayed at several Seattle area hotels and each has their appeal. Unlike some of my other favorite places to stay (listed below), the Silver Cloud Inn - Lake Union has them beat in overall value. If you want a place that's nice, but not hoity-toity, where you can stretch your dollar without losing amenties, the Silver Cloud Inn - Lake Union can't be beat. [Other area hotels I might recommend: Hotel Max = Rock n' roll style modern hotel within walking distance of The Paramount, Pacific Place and other downtown shopping/sights. Relatively inexpensive, but being in an old building has definite drawbacks -- pay to park, noisy on lower floors, and tight quarters, especially. Inn at the Market = Elegant botique hotel situated at Pike Place Market, within walking distance of the Seattle Art Museum, the Showbox and downtown shopping. Can be pricey, but wonderful views and service to be had.]

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Terri M
Reviews.Content: My son was visiting Seattle Pacific University, and we chose this hotel for its proximity to the college (about 2 miles away). I wasn't sure what to expect, but I got a good online rate ($129) and the pictures looked nice. We were delighted with our room! We had a two-queens regular, non-view room (we knew we weren't spending much time there, so why splurge for extras this time...) and it was very spacious! We had a hide-a-bed couch and coffee table, huge flat screen tv with a good selection of channels, two sink areas and very nice amenities (Aveda bath products, Tully's coffee, and a GOOD blow dryer!) Towels were large and fluffy and plentiful. We were given a copy of the Seattle Times in the morning, which was a nice alternative to the usual USA Today! Everything was spotless and the beds were very comfortable. My only complaint would be the heating/air system. It didn't seem to have a thermostat, (I could be wrong about this, as it was late when we went to bed, and I didn't spend a whole lot of time examining it--just turned it to a cooler temp) so it was just on or off and it was hard to get a comfortable sleeping temperature going. The fan wasn't overly loud, but it was a constant hum. It was nice to have free underground parking (particularly when I saw plenty of ice-covered cars on the road in the morning!) and free internet service. There was also a small business center which was free to use. We didn't use the pool or exercise room, but we looked at them and they were nice enough. The breakfast room was LOVELY with a fireplace, view of the lake and plenty of seating. Breakfast options were good (wafflemaker, bagels, pastries, muffins, hard-boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, yogurt, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, milk, juices). I was surprised at how many people were in the breakfast room, since we'd barely encountered anyone while we were there and the hallways and room were very quiet. We never had to wait for an elevator and there were plenty of parking spots in the garage. The location was convenient for the college visit and also very convenient for freeway access, and close to downtown. The staff was professional and helpful. I would definitely stay here on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Lovebly Hotel in Seattle !!”
Reviews.Author: Thundermx
Reviews.Content: It is an amazing hotel located in the North of Seattle. I have never been an incredible hotel like this before...perfectly care and clean and the service is great and kindly with wonderfull view to the lake. We stay 5 days and we enjoy every detail from the hotel. We were located in the seventh Floor and the advantage for the cool weather was a free garage underground so it is perfect for this winter weather. The breakfast is nice and includes several kind of coffee, eggs, waffles, sweet bread, cereals, fruit and yogurt and juices. All the time they have warm coffee and tea in the reception. The room is nice and have a comfortable King bed and comfortable leaving room. The bathroom is big and it includes steam iron, microwave and coffee maker and sink, hairdryer and accessories. Outside of the room there are washers & dryers and internet wireless free of charge. Definitely, I will stay again and again in this nice hotel located on Union Lake in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: bandits1
Reviews.Content: So I could not decide between Inn at Harbor Steps, Westin, Hyatt, or this property. I cannot say enough great stuff and how I chose the perfect property for families. We booked a suite, which was like an Embassy Suites Style, Huge Room, super clean, divided living room from Bedroom (son slept in Living Room). Breakfast was nothing amazing, but It was plenty and filling- Bagels, Waffles, Sweet Breads, Juice, Coffee and more. Great Shuttle and location. Will Stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with the advantages of a B&B”
Reviews.Author: skoolmarm
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 1 infant) stayed there for about a week. Our room was clean and spacious and included a gas fireplace and a lake view. The decor throughout was neutral and tasteful. The service was outstanding and staff were very kind in helping us with things we needed for the baby (portable crib, extra towels, etc.) and for ourselves. We made a lot of use of the shuttle service to and from downtown. The stops are convenient, the service very friendly and they even had a carseat for our little one to sit in. The breakfast buffet was more than enough to fill us up for the morning and we enjoyed the all-day hot drinks service in the lobby. The 24-hour pool was great in the middle of the night when we were awake due to jet-lag. The complimentary guest laundry (washer/dryer on most floors) was really handy and meant that we didn't have to bring a lot of extra clothes since we knew we could wash our stuff and the baby's things during the week. We brought our own detergent but I think the gift shop might sell single packets of powder for those in need. One negative of the hotel is its location; there's really not much in the area. Okay there are a few restaurants but not really for families or casual dining and not enough to keep you going for a whole week. There are really no other shops or cafes in the immediate vicinity. A supermarket or convenience store could be found within a 20-min walk but not closer than that. It's not a bad or dangerous neighborhood by any means, just kind of devoid of commerce. Oh, and hardly any restaurants even deliver to that neighborhood. It's just outside of the delivery range of most downtown restaurants and the few that do deliver in that area aren't very good. We were advised against some of them (reputation for yucky food) and the others that we did try were pretty awful all the same (cardboard pizza, overly-greasy stir-fry that caused bellypains). So if you're not prepared to get in the shuttle and/or drive somewhere for meals, or if you need late-night sustenance, you might end up out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: deedums_d
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure about the area at first but better than expected. Local restaurants along the road in walking distance. Shuttle service to 3 locations in downtown Seattle which was great. Hotel was clean and breakfast was enough of a choice to keep us happy. Comfortable stay and good service.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent local hotel chain”
Reviews.Author: jake3_14
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect from a local chain, and I was very pleasantly surprised to have all my expectations met. The king bed and armchair-ottoman combo were comfortable and in good repair, lighting was plentiful, the floors were well padded (good for my morning stretches), the wireless internet access was trouble-free, the room ventilation worked well, and the showerhead was unclogged (little things count!). The in-room microwave and refrigerator were godsends, allowing my wife and I to economize on our meal expenses. The continental breakfasts included some protein as well as grains (I eat low-carb), so the hotel gets bonus points for that. The hotel even has a nicely equipped gym, with cardio, machines, dumbbells, and stability balls, so I could do complete workouts. The complementary computer room (with printer) was a novelty for me, and I appreciated it when it came time to print our boarding passes. The one time we requested housekeeping service -- paper towels at 7:30 PM -- they were at our door within 10 minutes. The room was always immaculate, even though we left later in the mornings, after the housekeeping staff made its first rounds. The desk staff was courteous and attentive. Being close to I-5, the major north-south highway here, is a plus, although the one-way streets around it require some learning. The price was very reasonable, too, considering all the amenities. The Silver Cloud chain pays attention to the big and small things, making our stay here very pleasant. We would definitely consider staying here again on our next trip to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise on edge of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Sierra225
Reviews.Content: I had looked at the Silver Cloud on line, but chose a cheaper hotel closer to downtown. The other hotel was less than expected, so we called and switched. We were pleasantly surprised at everything. Parking was included. The pool was indoor, heated and nice. Breakfast was wonderful with lots of choices and in a very pleasant room with a great view of the lake and the seaplanes, looking toward the picturesque hills across the lake. The room was a little larger that a standard hotel room and the chair converted to a single bed, making the 5 of us very comfortable. The TV was a large flat screen - nice. Our view was just of the buildings behind, but if you get an upper floor on the lake side, the views are gorgeous. We took the hotel shuttle to a Mariners game - very convienent not to have to drive.
