I wish I had known how much we would have enjoyed our selves here and stayed longer. I think on the map, the location looks far from the center of town, but that really isn't the case. We found some of the streets downtown to be a little seedy, so unless you are on the waterfront directly, or at one of the pricey boutique hotels, avoid the cheaper rooms a few blocks from 2nd St. A few more blocks and you are at Lake Union, just behind the Space Needle, actually very close and with the shuttle service, you won't have to worry about finding parking. Then just relax and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “It depends on what you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: shesails
Reviews.Content: Uncomfortable bed, no safe, heater smelled like burnt toast, otherwise everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: screen9
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Lake Union Silver Cloud hotel. We stayed three weeknights and felt right at home. The room we reserved was a suite with a view and were located overlooking Lake Union. Watching the activity on the water which included many seaplanes was entertaining. There are excellent restaurants within walking distance and very pleasant and safe grounds to walk around. The staff was excellent as well as the breakfasts. We had one issue where there were no sheets on the hide-a-bed, but the manager (Jay) was very professional in correcting the issue. We definitely plan to stay at this establishment again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeC52
Reviews.Content: We completed our Northwest vacation with three nights in Seattle at the Silver Cloud Inn. It could not have been better for the price, convenience of location and hospitality. Paying the extra for the lake view was worth the price as has been previously recommended. We agree. The breakfast each morning was fantastic and very popular over the weekend. The free shuttle the hotel provides is a great convenience as well. Overall we were very pleased - the room was clean, updated and roomy with a couch and sitting area. Also a free washing machine and dryer were available on the floor. Wonderful! If you are looking for a high rise downtown hotel experience this would not be your choice -- if you are looking to get a little out of that scene and stay nearby in the Lake Union area - this is the best possible place.

Reviews.Title: “no gray skies at this Silver Cloud”
Reviews.Author: Musiclover9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silver Cloud in mid-July , having selected it based upon the TripAdvisor.com reviews. It was my first trip to the beautiful city of Seattle. Silver Cloud Inn is a wonderful, spotlessly clean hotel. The staff are instantly cheerfully available. The room is nicely designed and well equipped. I was traveling alone but noticed many multigenerational families and I would imagine that his inn meets the needs of all ages. The swimming pool is extremely clean and open long hours. The complimentary shuttle to various points is a huge benefit and money saver, although public transport in Seattle is moderately priced and extensive. The buffet breakfasts were perfect for someone like me who does not require a lumberman's special, plenty of fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, bagels, a waffle maker. There is always free coffee in the lobby. I really liked the Silver Cloud Inn tremendously and wish that they were also located in New England, my home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbtraveler58
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to say about the Silver Cloud Inn- Lake Union. The staff was extremely friendly, the continental breakfast was quite convenient and the shuttle bus was fabulous. The shuttle runs from 7 AM- 11PM M-F and 9AM-11PM during the weekend. The shuttle runs about every half hour. The shuttle drops you off near the Pike Place Market, in Pioneer Square by the underground tour, by the Space Needle and near Safeco Field (where the Mariners play). The area around the hotel is quiet and I felt quite safe. You can always have dinner by the Pike Place Market or somewhere else downtown. However, if you would prefer to have dinner near the hotel, there are numerous restaurants (Duke's- I loved it, Joeys, Chandlers Crabhouse- a bit pricy, Blu Water Bistro and a steak house).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestEmptynester
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed in a Silver Cloud hotel (it's a west coast chain) but liked what we saw online. Got a good rate and asked for a non-smoking room, the highest floor we could get. We only booked for one night, just to be on the safe side. We ended up getting the best room in the entire place (ask for Room 745). It was on the top floor, southwest corner and was a king suite, which means it had a separate room for the bed (love the cushy linens!). The living room area had a gas fireplace, a flat screen above it (there's one in the bedroom area too), a fold out loveseat, deak, mini-fridge, microwave, dishes, bar sink, French doors that open to a view of the harbor and even the Space Needle! There is no balcony, but a railing so even while you're standing in the room you feel like you're outside. Because we were on the end, we also had windows to the south in both the living area and the bedroom area. Two sinks, tub/shower... On Tuesdays there is an appetizer/wine/beer reception from 5:30-6:30, and every day there is a nice Continental breakfast in a great 3rd floor room that has outside balcony seating. Plus, there is a pool, exercise room, business center, free internet, and a free shuttle that takes you to Peyton Square, the Space Needle, or Pikes Place Market. It leaves every 30 minutes and will pick you up to bring you back with just a phone call. Talk about service! We added an extra night to our stay and would have stayed more but we decided to head up to Canada. A gem. Oh. And ask for Christine at the desk.. She was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud really is as great as all the reviews say”
Reviews.Author: tnncs
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Silver Cloud for 5 nights at the end of June. I chose it based on all the positive reviews on tripadvisor, and was not disappointed. We had a lake view room with french doors that opened, but no balcony. It didn't matter as the view was wonderful and the fresh air welcoming. It was definitely worth the extra money for the lake view. We had a perfect view of the space needle and sea planes and kayaks on the lake. We loved the free shuttle service to downtown, indoor pool, breakfast, computers, laundry facilities on each floor, and friendly staff. It was the perfect hotel for our family- the kids loved it as well- and a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - Much improved fitness area”
Reviews.Author: SJ46
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Silver Cloud before and returned because it is great value for what you pay. The view over Lake Union is spectacular and worth the little extra we paid for it. Parking is secure and if you have a van or SUV you can park it on the upper level where the parking spaces are larger and actually designed for these larger vehicles. If you have stayed at a Silver Cloud hotel before you will know that they have a very good breakfast each morning that is included in the cost of your room. The breakfast area is very family friendly as is the whole hotel. Great place for families with kids. This is a 100% smoke free hotel which we appreciate. Also, it has been two years since we stayed at the Silver Cloud Lake Union and the biggest improvement I noticed was to the fitness area. They moved it from a tiny little room on the first floor to an outstanding room on the 3rd floor. It has lots of first-class equipment and three TV screens to watch while you are working out. My only complaint was that the mats in the fitness area were very thin and not very useful. I guess you could use two or three at once when you're doing your stretching. Aside from the mat issue though this was probably the best hotel fitness area I have seen in a long time. The hotel is also in a good area for runners or walkers and I noticed quite a few runners out by themselves which is always a good sign from a safety perspective. The shuttle service is also included in the cost of your room and will take you to downtown Seattle. We are a family of four and the shuttle service (a 10 or 12 passenger van) took us to Seattle Center, then picked us up later when we phoned for it. I'd suggest tipping the driver a couple of dollars as they do save you a lot of hassle by navigating the Seattle traffic on your behalf and save you having to pay taxi fare. The hotel is located just a few minutes from Interstate 5.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud great for families”
Reviews.Author: KR0745
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud in June of this year. We found it to be a great hotel for families. We stayed in a suite with french doors overlooking Lake Union.We loved watching the float planes on the lake. The Breakfast area was beautiful, large and overlooking the lake as well. We appreciated the shuttle service, very convenient. One night we had a problem with the bathroom toilet, the hotel promptly sent someone up, fixed the problem, and took the whole night's stay off our bill! Our room was comfortable, clean and spacious. We love the "feel" of the hotel, very family friendly. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean rooms-Good location.”
Reviews.Author: csh824
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Seattle where we stayed three nights at the Silver Cloud Inn -Lake Union. I chose to get a room facing the lake and am very happy I did as it was nice to watch all the boats and the seaplanes. The bed was very comfortable and the room nicely configured with a desk, a small sofa and coffee table, a large flat screen TV under which was a cabinet containing a fridge and microwave . The bathroom was very clean and nice-also very nice to have the extra sink outside the bathroom. The rooms were very quiet-no noise from the hallway or rooms next door. We used the public transit to get to the hotel and to get around town-very easy with the bus stop right outside the hotel, also the South Lake Union Streetcar stops just a short distance away. We also used the hotel shuttle- very convenient. The continental breakfast was very good and served in a very pleasant area. All in all I would stay there again-although I would chose a time when the rates were lower. I thought it was a little pricey-especially when you have to pay extra for a view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CathyDan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, will def stay there again. The rooms were big & clean, fridge & microwave came in handy, free breakfast was great & free shuttle to/from Qwest Field was very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: pdxsparky
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this Silver Cloud Inn on several occasions, and can highly recommend it. The location is excellent -- close to freeways and downtown Seattle -- and the comfort and value are top-notch.

Reviews.Title: “NIce views, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stevenr35
Reviews.Content: Not my first visit to the Lake Union Silver Cloud Inn. Staff are always incredibly helpful and polite: a real plus to the hotel. The rooms are a little basic (certainly there's no luxury here,) but they are completely serviceable. No bar or restaurant in the hotel but there is a shop where you can buy essentials and charge them to you your room. There is a continental breakfast provided which is reasonable and very popular and included in the price of the room. There's a pool (never used it) and a very small fitness room (one treadmill) but at the time of my visit they were busy expanding the fitness 'centre' which I think was long overdue The location is slightly out of the way of downtown (for example, you can't do one of those van shares to the airport from here) but there is a great new tram service taking you to downtown which terminates right outside the hotel. But Seattle isn't a big city so being 2 miles away from downtown isn't a big problem. A real bonus is the fantastic free hotel shuttle service to downtown and the Seattle Centre (and some other locations). So the hotel isn't luxurious and not necessarily cheap given the accomodation quality, but all the little extras they provide make it worth checking out as a hotel when in Seattle. Do check out the lake view rooms as the view is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cfieldguide
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a great weekend in Seattle. The Silver Cloud Inn was part of this great experience. Our room overlooked Lake Union and we enjoyed watching the sun set over the lake and the boats in the harbour. The room was very clean and comfortable with a large plasma screen tv. which impressed my husband. The staff was friendly and helpful. We certainly enjoyed eating the complementary breakfast in the lovely well appointed breakfast room which overlooks the lake. The breakfast offered included waffles, bagels, cereal, yoghurt, fresh fruit, juice, etc. Unlike many hotels, this hotel offers free secured parking. The hotel has a free shuttle bus that runs every half hour into down town Seattle. It drops off and picks up at designated places. There is also a tram car just a half block from hotel that goes into the big mall downtown. For price, location, and amenities this hotel has it all. We will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ForTheWeekend
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and on the price (they were offering a slight discount, but I think the price was still a little high for what it was). The room was a good size, but I wouldn't exactly call it a "Deluxe" Water View King Room. The view was nice when we were sitting on the bed because we were far enough away from the window to avoid seeing the commercial buildings and the street below. The location kind of sucked, except that it was a quick shuttle-ride/drive into downtown and it was a short walk to Dukes Chowder House (fantastic food, good service, kid-friendly) along a pretty little boardwalk. The free shuttle was great. The driver was very nice, they had a car-seat for our toddler, and they left the hotel every half-hour (this has obviously changed from the once-an-hour departures of last December). We were excited by the big-screen tv in our room, as we were hoping to watch a movie on it - the only problem was, the movie I was dying to see wasn't working properly (the desk attendant said it had been watched too many times). The best part of our stay was definitely the continental breakfast - had yummy self-made waffles with strawberry sauce and yogurt, the coffee was decent (we liked that they offered free coffee in the lobby - wasn't always hot, but better than having to make it in our room), and it was a bright and spacious room. We also liked that the hotel had it's own tiny convenient store. So, although our initial impression was a little disappointing due to the not-so-scenic location and thanks to an unfriendly and unhelpful man at the front desk (he had absolutely no interest in giving me any tips about the area and didn't smile once), our over-all stay wasn't bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied; would stay again”
Reviews.Author: uwis66
Reviews.Content: We selected the Silver Cloud Inn Lake Union based in large part on its excellent reviews on tripadvisor.com. We wanted one of the hotels on Lake Union because we were attending the Seattle Boat Show. The Silver Cloud Inn turned out to be an excellent choice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was quite large and very clean and comfortable, with a lovely view of the lake. The breakfast (included in the price) was fine -- it's a "serve yourself" buffet. There aren't alot of choices, but it served our needs perfectly. One huge plus for this hotel is the shuttle bus service between the hotel and downtown. When it's not too busy, they will even take you to or pick you up at a specific downtown location, wherever you might want. The ONLY negative we found was that there is no bar in the hotel and you can't even buy a bottle of wine in the sundries shop. But, there are plenty of places nearby, so it probably won't matter to most people. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: kaypo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay here and it was a very pleasant stay. Staff was friendly, shuttle was a plus. Wasn't very crowded, maybe since it is January as was most places we visited wasn't crowded as well. Free parking can't be beat. Our room,(5th floor) was quite spacious and clean. Our view consisted of building construction and I-5 overpass, no biggie as we were gone most of the day. Good food less than 10 mins. walk away. Have to try Duke's clam chowder, the best! About the only minus is 2 nights I went downstairs to get of coffee and they were out. Also one morning during breakfast, they were out as well. Breakfast is so-so, basic.The breakfast room as well as the lobby is cosy . Family with children will be disappointed that there is no kids channel except PBS in the morning but other than that good selection of channels . All in all, you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AT1955
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Silver Cloud on several occasions and never had a single problem. I finally decided I should write a review. This is a great location if you want quick, easy access to downtown Seattle. I did not have a car so I used the hotel shuttle service, which was excellent. The staff is super friendly and the rooms are clean and nicely done. All in all, it is just a great hotel. I don't even bother looking at other hotels anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kjb3751
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Silver Cloud - Lake Union a few times the last couple times and have had a great experience each time. The staff is always very professional and courteous. The rooms, the morning breakfast and shuttle service are all great and add to the whole package. I would highly recomend this hotel to everyone reading this.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud Inn - Never Disappoints”
Reviews.Author: scottymack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a long flight home from LA. Before the flight we stayed near the airport and just had an awful experience. So we decided to just go with what we know for the trip home. Yes, it was about a 20 minute drive from the airport, but at least we know what we are getting when we stay at any of the Silver Cloud Inn's. A clean comfortable room. With beds you can just sink right into. I love that the parking is gated, not that it's going to stop someone who is really bent on breaking into your car, but it was nice. The 24 hour pool was great to come to, since our kids were just wired from the flight, and it was a great time to just go down there and let them relax. We got up too late to enjoy the breakfast, but if it's anything like the other ones we have experienced at other Silver Cloud Inn's, I'm sure it is wonderful. If you are looking a clean comfortable room with great customer service this is the place to go. We will definitely stay here for our next trip to downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good family place”
Reviews.Author: GuinnessGuy
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews the Silver Cloud LU didn't disappoint at all. The 24hour pool/hot tub was a nice treat for the kids after a late arrival. The room was nicer than our room at the Sheraton Downtown two weeks ago and the Aveda toiletries were better. But the highlight was the huge lovely breakfast room -- the food was good (hard boiled eggs a nice plus for vegetarians) but the room is great. Lots of big windows and a variety of seating. Extremely comfortable. We were disappointed that the shuttle only ran every hour instead of the half hour but it was still convenient and the free parking is a bonus. We'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: jennlben
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a little alone time. He just came back from Iraq and we needed a night out away from the kids. The service desk was so helpful...giving us great ideas about where to eat and some local favorite hangouts. We had a wonderful evening, even got to enjoy the hot tub since it's open 24 hours. The next morning, we had an amazing breakfast---it wasn't just donuts and coffee! An actual breakfast was available. We then went to the Seahawks- Bears game... (Silver Cloud has a shuttle...and saved us $40 on parking) We are Bears fans so it was a sad day for us. Other then the Bears Game---which wasn't Silver Clouds fault that they lost..the trip was priceless! A big thanks to Christopher Greenway...he works there and really made our stay extra special! If you drop in say hello to him!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, central location”
Reviews.Author: Lobbster
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights this past weekend on advice of a friend! We were extremely happy with the hotel, and its central location. The breakfast is great, and the business center and pool are open 24hrs, and everything is included in the price including internet use and parking. A great value. Great restaurants right across the street. Would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JFMCL
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality hotel that is does all the necessary things well at a reasonable price. It is a slightly out of the centre of town but the shuttle bus provides an efficient service and I would recommend the bistro across the road for an excellent evening meal. The room was quite large and had every thing you need and the staff were both efficient and friendly. The elevators were a bit slow and the alternative one left you in the car park but this is a minor problem.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfast with huge bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: uratargetmarket
Reviews.Content: This was the highest standard hotel I stayed in whilst in America and Canada. The rooms are just simply enormous...we didn't know how to fill all the space. The breakfast is also amazing. Maybe standard for American visitors...but for English people I was just staggered by the range of doughnuts and muffins and the fact that I could make my waffle myself Staying out at Lake Union definitely gives you a different side to Seattle and it's really quiet by the harbour. However again being an English person, the "free" taxi service the hotel offers obviously isnt free as you have to tip...and tip higher than by British standards. Apart from that I highly recommend this hotel for the price, very warm in winter and very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “glorified travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Kate014
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September and my impression was of a glorified travelodge. There's no attached bar, restaurant, etc. So it's mainly a lobby - albeit with a sofa, TV & coffee - or your room. My room was pricey enough, was a lakeview room and while it did face the lake and had a fairly reasonable view of it... there was a 4 lane road and various boat-works between the hotel and the lake. I found this a bit misleading and to say it's 'on Lake Union' as their website does, makes you disappointed when you get there. If you are expecting to be on the lake shore .... forget it. If you are expecting normal hotel amenities (e.g. bar, restaurant).... there're not there. The place seemed to be geared up more for conferences and there was a few of these going on when I was there. Also there is a shop which sells ready meals etc which wasn't the vibe I was expecting. Having said this the rooms have a fridge and microwave and there is a fitness centre. Also there is a mini-bus shuttle service that runs on the half hour and brings you to Downtown/Westlake Mall. Overall probably good for conferences, poor for holidays

Reviews.Title: “Tripadvisor gem”
Reviews.Author: quetzal
Reviews.Content: The Tripadvisor reviews prompted me to book a 2 night stay at this hotel. The outside appearance is misleading - inside: very nice staff, clean rooms, and efficient downtown shuttle. The breakfast ( yes, the waffle iron is a fun touch) is available early 6:30AM and was also good. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location........Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellightMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our three day visit to Seattle. Since our son would be staying with my wife and I, we booked a suite. It was particularly spacious with flat screen TV and fire place in the sitting area with the fold out sofa. Price of $209 per night was very good considering that it was only a few dollars more than the Marriot properties in the area were charging for regular hotel rooms. Location and views over Lake Union were wonderful and only noise was from the seaplanes taking off and landing outside our door........lovely to watch. All amenities that could be imagined, hotel in good updated condition. Don't be fooled by the exterior which is probably from an older 60's style property....this is a gem inside !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for precruise stop”
Reviews.Author: Sea2Mountain
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday morning and were fortunate to be allowed to check-in early. The front desk clerk was very friendly and effeciently checked us in while providing key highlights about parking and the shuttle. We were impressed by the clean room with lots of pillows and the comfortable beds. I liked that they provided Aveda shampoo, conditioner and lotion in the bathroom. We did take advantage of the free shuttle to get to the Space Needle for dinner. It worked very well as we made reservations for the 4:30PM shuttle to make it for 5:00PM reservations and called for the shuttle after dinner to see it arrive in the 15 minutes as promised. The breakfast was great. We liked the boiled eggs, fresh hot waffles and other items. The breakfast room was cozy with lots of natural light despite the fact that it was raining outside the whole time. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for an extended stay”
Reviews.Author: Gr8Outdrs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just had a very pleasant 5 night stay at the Silver Cloud - Lake Union. It was our first stay at this hotel chain and we will definitely use them again. Very clean and pleasant facilities. Surprisingly nice amenities incl. pool with hot tub (outdoor pool was closed, but indoor pool was working), huge FLAT SCREEN TV in our King Suite room, free laundry machines on every floor and a decent continental breakfast (incl. waffles, oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, and the usual muffin/bagel assortment). If you eat the breakfast (which everyone does) don't be late b/c they close down RIGHT on the dot. I am a light sleeper and was awoken by some street noise from our room, which faced the back of our hotel b/c there were garbage trucks going down the street, but ear plugs did the trick. Location was out of the bustling downtown area, which we prefer. Lake Union is lovely, and there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Also, the complimentary shuttle is PRICELESS. We also used the public bus which stops right out front. If you are there on a Tuesday, don't miss the weekly happy hour reception which featured a live band (!!), open bar and food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilites but nothing outstanding”
Reviews.Author: JayPDee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a group of four and shared one suite. Although the room itself was pricey, once you figure the rate per person it works out pretty good value. For extra privacy in the room you could pull a divider across, effectively splitting it in two. Each half of the room had its own TV but to get to the bathroom from the one half you had to walk through the other bedroom. The breakfast was reasonable with the highlight of making your own waffles. The waffle machine seemed to confuse some people, this in itself was quite amusing to watch... The indoor pool was a relaxing rest after a few hours touring downtown. Plus any review must mention the free shuttle that takes you pretty much anywhere within downtown and, if you're nice, slightly off track. Overall a pleasant stay and would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & service!”
Reviews.Author: margiemhu
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the end of July at the Silver Cloud on Lake Union. We were very impressed with the room - larger than average and very clean. We had asked for a crib and they delivered one within a few minutes of our check-in. The employee who delivered it even offered to set it up. All of the employees we dealt with were pleasant, helpful and very professional, no small feat considering we were traveling with our very active, noisy 2-year-old. There is free internet in the lobby. The breakfast was simple but good - the waffles were awesome.The 3rd floor lobby where they serve breakfast has a lovely balcony overlooking the lake. I'd recommend the hotel to anyone, particularly those traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: pmorena
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at the Silver Cloud Inn because they offered a free shuttle after our cruise arrived back in Seattle. It was a bonus to learn the shuttle was available for other destinations as well. Hotel staff recommended that our grandchildren -- ages 3, 8 & 10, would enjoy the Pacific Science Center rather than the Children's Museum and they were right! The shuttle brought us to the Science Center and then picked us up. We were able to walk to Duke's Chowder House for a delicious dinner and enjoyed a very nice hot and cold Continental breakfast the next morning. The room was very comfortable and it was a pleasure to have two sinks in separate areas. After a week of cruising without access to a computer, it was also nice to find their business center offered internet access and free printing. The Lake Union area is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but a bit quirky”
Reviews.Author: LADWhitePlains
Reviews.Content: The hotel is built on a very steep hill. As a result, the hotel's two banks of elevators are separated by a garage entrance on the first floor. The elevator in the main lobby is a bit slow. Access to the parking garages (one is on the first floor,the other on the second with separate entrances) with a vehicle requires a skilled driver and the spots are very tight. Rooms in the back do not have a view of Lake Union, only those in the front, but our room was comfortable and a bit larger than most. If you can settle for the view at breakfast only, you might prefer the lower rates offered for the back rooms. The location of the hotel is excellent, Lake Union is directly across the street and the hotel is a just a few minutes to all the downtown areas of Seattle. Breakfast is served in the third floor lobby with a wonderful view but there not enough tables to accommodate everyone and late comers will need to sit on an lounge chair or a sofa. The waffle makers are wonderful but a line forms during peak times. Overall this is a lovely spot, a comfortable and convenient hotel in an up and coming neighborhood of Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Usually perfect”
Reviews.Author: z_portland
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here multiple times and its usually great. I highly recommend spending the extra $ to get a view room - the view of Lake Union is really beautiful. The breakfast is very nice, not outstanding, but good. The beds are excellent. The last time we went, we arrived with our two kids ready to swim, but the pool was closed for repair! We were very upset since this is the main reason we go to this hotel. They offered to take a small discount off our room and said we could use their sister hotel's pool. However, their shuttle was booked. So we drove over to the other hotel. Their pool was fridged. We swim often and I think this is the coldest pool I've tolerated - we felt like we had to stay and swim a while for the kids and since we drove all the way there. Five days later on our return trip, we called and the pool was fixed, so we stayed there again and had a great time. I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Experience”
Reviews.Author: Principal Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for six days at the Silver Cloud on Lake Union for a week-long symposium. First the positives: The hotel has a cooperative staff, a lovely third floor "view" lobby of the lake, a daily newspaper delivered to your room, a continental breakfast that is included, and a cost-free shuttle van service that will transport you to downtown Seattle. The negatives: The rooms are average to say the least- a little worn and small in size. My room had not been thorougly cleaned before my arrival- trash cans had not been emptied. The hotel is not near the center of the city- you need to take a public bus or use the shuttle van to go downtown, a definite negative for tourists. In addition, there is no sign when you approach the hotel from the south- the place is unremarkable and resembles an apartment building (there is a sign on the side of the building which you can only see when you approach the hotel from the north side. In addition, although it was mid-July, the outdoor pool was closed (there is an indoor pool) and there wasn't any patio furniture around the pool. All in all, a good place to hold a meeting but a not-so-good place for a vacation. You may want to look elsewhere !

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business”
Reviews.Author: shadow6
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in early July. I was not able to get a King suite but settled on a double Queen. I was not dissapointed however. The room was clean, the service was excellent, parking was great, and the location was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: alaskarat
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice, clean and friendly hotel. It would have been hard to find if not for my trusty Garmin GPS thing. The hotel is not marked very well from the road. Check in was very fast and we had our room keys with in a few minutes. If you come in late like we did parking is tight if there is any parking at all. I did manage to squeeze into a parking space marked for a compact. The continental breakfast was good although it seemed to be a combat breakfast as the poor starving masses descend on to the free food. I used the shuttle service once to go downtown to the market. Leaving on the shuttle is easy, make sure you check with the desk for room aboard it. For pick up you need to call the hotel to get the shuttle to your location, be patient because this could take awhile. Although listed as having an outdoor heated pool it is closed and the hotel plans on turning that area into a work out room thing. The Housekeeping staff was very, very good and patient with us. If I ever go back to Seattle I will stay at the hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, breakfast and service - mild issue with shuttle”
Reviews.Author: AlbionbytheSea
Reviews.Content: First time here based on TA reviews. Taxi from airport was approx $40. Room with view over lake union with 2 queens was approx $200/ night. But since this includes b'fast for a family of four, and free shuttle transportation - this was very reasonable. The hotel is well run, very clean and comfortable with a great breakfast (comp'd). The waffles were my kids favourites! The shuttle service is a plus but has some limitations. It runs every 30 mins, but you must schedule your spots, so spontaneity may be limited! Also to get back you must phone and wait - once up to 45 mins in the cold and rain. They have apprx 5 drop spots in Seattle, but in the eve's will generally take you directly to a restaurant. We ate in Seattle at Purple Cafe, Zoe's and then in Ballard at Ray's Cafe. All recommended - see my reviews. Fridge's in room. Pool on site was great - but pool room was hot. Free coffee avail 24hrs in lobby. Hotel took us to Amtrak stn when we needed to leave. Highly recommended. About a 5 min distance from space needle.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great for the money”
Reviews.Author: Iowacubslover
Reviews.Content: vWe had asked for a room with a view and we did get one with a great view.of the lake. The room size was okay but for parents with two teenaers, it was not spacious. There were two sinks outside of the bathroom which helped with getting ready in the morning, There were several things that we did not like about this hotel. First, the employees at the front desk were not friendly. Second, other reviewers have raved about the shuttle. We found it to be a joke. They could not take us when we wanted to go and they could "maybe" pick us up but we would have to call ahead to check. There was a baseball game that evening which took priority over people who were not attending. We ended up walking to the Space Needle and after waiting awhile we finally got a ride back. The driver did not acknowledge us and was on his cell phone, talking to a friend, most of the ride to the hotel. Third, I know that others complimented the breakfast but we stayed there 2 nights and was at the breakfast each day 15 minutes before they closed. There was very little food left unless you could find someone to ask for more. The area was very understaffed. If a hotel posts an ending time for breakfast, they should have food available until that time! In conclusion, we would not stay at the Silver Cloud Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: my4sweets
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We had 2 queen view rooms with a beautiful view of Lake Union and the space needle! The rooms are adequately sized and very comfortable. The breakfast was great with a lovely sunroom on the third floor to eat in. On Tuesday evenings they had a great reception with live music in the sunroom. It was wonderful! The best part about our stay was the GREAT shuttle service. We parked our car in the parking lot and never used it again because the hotel offers a shuttle van! They drop you off at a designated drop-off point and pick you up when you're ready!They even take guests to Mariners games and pick them up afterwards! I highly recommend this hotel. We will definitely stay here again when we visit Seattle. Seattle is a great city and we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: another_mother
Reviews.Content: Arrived after the Mariners baseball game on Friday evening. Check in was okay. Room was smaller than we had anticipated, as we had gotten a suite and it was tight with two adults and two older teenage boys! Parking spaces were SO NARROW that we had difficulty getting in and out of our van. There was not alot of room for error when you were backing up either. Continental breakfast was plentiful with waffles, juice/coffee, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, cheese, bagels/toast, danish, cereal, apples and oranges. It was nice to open up the living area doors to look at Lake Union, but there was no balcony to speak of (BE CAREFUL, those railings are wobbly!) Okay for a weekend stay but we will not stay here again as we find the Silver Cloud Broadway is better for us.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalBlonde
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience staying at the Silver Cloud Lake Union. The hotel is very clean, nicely decorated, has a great shuttle service, and is located across from Lake Union. They have a lovely breakfast each morning on the third floor overlooking Lake Union. The hotel is within walking distance to many fine restaurants (Joey's was our favorite) on the lake. We did not have to rent a car because the shuttle was free. It picked us up at the train station and dropped us off at several locations during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible View”
Reviews.Author: KBOOFER
Reviews.Content: Our stay has been wonderful, beautiful view, friendly staff,shuttle driver, a very nice kid. We appreciated the shuttle service. the breakfast room , another gorgeous view. We will return. Mark and Kim

Reviews.Title: “A nice part of Seattle”
Reviews.Author: nsquare
Reviews.Content: Our 9 day vacation in the Pacific Northwest ended with a three day visit to Seattle. The city has so many interesting areas I had a hard time deciding where to stay. I am so glad I choose The Silver Cloud Inn on Lake Union. We had an upper floor with an upgrade for a lake view. It was worth it, because at night we could look out our balcony and off to the side we could see the Space Needle. During the day you could watch the seaplanes take off. The Hotel is very clean and the room was more than enough space for the three of us. Husband, wife and 14 year old daughter. The best part of the hotel for my daughter was the "make your own waffles" every morning out on the beautiful sun room/breakfast area. There were many items to choose from on the breakfast buffet and it was complimentary. My husband and I used the free shuttle service that the hotel offers. We took it into town for the Pioneer Village underground tour. That was so much fun. The tour guides are full of fun stories and goofy jokes. They kept the tour moving right along and you learn a bit of Seattle history. History teachers should be this amuzing. At the end of the day, you call the hotel and the shuttle bus comes to get you! It was amazingly efficient, friendly and free. The hotel staff was very helpful in giving recommendations on places to eat and travel directions. They always greeted you as you came in and left for the day. They seemed proud of their city and their job. The hotel also offers free parking. You didn't need a car to walk to the restaurants along Lake Union. We had two fine dinners at Dukes. Try the halibut...yummy ..reasonably priced and the waitress was so nice to us. You can't go wrong with this hotel. I loved Seatle and got to catch a fish at Pike Place Fish Market.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location, but given room next to road construction.”
Reviews.Author: DowningUk
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for just one night to experience a little of what Seattle had to offer before our flight out of Sea Tac airport the next evening. We found the hotel clean, well maintained, a good varied breakfast, providing a lovely indoor pool and hot tub and also free undercover locked car parking. Also the location was good as it was just across the road from a marina and wharf. We were slightly let door as we paid extra for a deluxe water view room, however, we were given a room on the side of the hotel as opposed to the front, and from our balcony we could some of the lake, but we were right next to some major road construction to the rear of the hotel. We were woken to the sounds of drilling and diggers etc. We live in the UK, and are used to walking most places. Space Needle is a 15 min walk away, however we found the walk using a pedestrian underpass recommended by the hotel to be unnerving and dangerous, especially as we have children. However, the hotel does provide a regular free shuttle bus to the main sights. We also used the monorail from Space Needle to downtown, and then had a short stroll to the Public Market which really had a good vibe about it. We also took the children to the Music and Sci-Fi Museums which we thought were good value and great for a family on a rainy day.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud Inn - excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: scrabblevixen
Reviews.Content: For the price, the hotel entirely exceeded our expectations. Although it is a bit of a hike to downtown, there is a free shuttle service, and they are more than happy to both pick you up and drop you off at your convenience. Breakfast was huge, with everything from waffles to a variety of fruit, and the beds were big and comfy. We were initially given a disabled room and the shower wasn't to our liking, but the management was quick to change it and it was hassle-free. My boyfriend and I will definitely be back if we're in the Seattle area again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Silver Cloud Lake Union”
Reviews.Author: lopezluck
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13 year old son and I stayed at Silver Cloud Lake Union for 5 nights in late March - early April. The room we had was perfect for us...a king size bed & TV, with a separate sitting area divided with pocket doors featuring a sleeper-sofa, micro, fridge and sink, and a plasma screen TV! The reasonable room rate featured a fantastic breakfast, including make your own waffles, several bread and muffin selections, cheese, boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit and juice...and really good coffee! There was also free internet in the room and a business center downstairs where we printed our boarding passes for the return flight home. The free shuttle was great, took us to all the tourist spots we wanted to see: Seattle Center (Space Needle, Experience Music Project, Science Fiction Museum, Key Arena, etc...), Pike Place Market, Seattle Aquarium, Pioneer Square, Downtown...it runs from the hotel every 30 minutes and can get full, so you do have to plan a bit in advance, but we had no troubles reserving space. The staff were all unfailingly polite and helpful. The indoor pool and jacuzzi were a blessing for us after a long "hard" day sightseeing. Lake Union is a bit out of the way from downtown, but we liked that. The marina area across the street has a good selection of restaurants and is interesting in itself. We had a great time in this beautiful city, and though cloudy and chilly, it barely rained at all during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't use your legs they'll fall off!”
Reviews.Author: CamilleJeanPierre
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked this place but then I'm more than happy to do a lot of walking as I like to get down and dirty in any new city I visit. The main drawback is that this place is a good 20 mins walk from downtown or any other main areas (apart from Lake Union, of course), and I know that there are a lot of people out there that are a bit reluctant to use their legs out there (if you don't use them they'll fall off, by the way). If that's you then don't go here: stay central. If however you like good value accomodation in a centrally accessable location, with good sized comfortable rooms, and a nice little relaxed buffet breakfast with a view I would highly recommend this place. You might also consider the Silver Cloud in the University district if you are under 40 as the area is a little more interesting for bars and eateries, but about the same distance from downtown. My main gripe would be the poor cheap lighting in the rooms by the mirrors (you can always tell when you're in a higher star hotel - they have good lighting) - they made the bags under eyes look really bad, man! PS - the free wireless is an excellent bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud says: Lump It Or Leave It, We Don't Care”
Reviews.Author: Chispada
Reviews.Content: Most other people seem to have had a nice experience here, and I certainly don't wish to negate that. We saw a lot of families having a nice time. I wish I could say the same, but I cannot. I still feel angry about our experience here--not because a mistake in booking was made, but because the management was so rude about it. The story-- After reading a lot of good reviews, I booked this hotel for 3 adults, requesting a suite on the main floor and a disabled bathroom. (We were traveling with my elderly and disabled mother, who was in a wheelchair.) I did a lot of online research and made several phone calls to verify these points. I was really looking forward to the hotel--the reviews were good and I thought my mom would be really happy. Yet when we arrived, exhausted from a day of air travel and driving, we were informed that our room wasn't a suite, had no disabled bathroom, and wasn't on the main floor. So I asked for the manager--and waited. The manager eventually appeared. He didn't quite suggest we get lost--at least not directly --but he might as well have. His manner and words made it clear that we were a pain and a problem and it was a take-it-or-leave-it situation. I've backpacked in Europe, and roughed it in Mexico and China --- I've never been treated so dismissively. I had the clear impression he was trying to get us to leave. They eventually booked us into another room which supposedly had a disabled bathroom. Did anyone come up with us to see to it that the room was okay? No. Was it okay? No. There was no disabled bathroom AND it was next to the venting outlets AND it smelled unclean. So we went downstairs to complain again--to no avail. We would certainly have gone elsewhere but there was nothing available--believe me, I called a bunch of hotels!!. A few days later they moved us (at our strenous request) to a cleaner room. We were in town for family business, so we put the best face on it and stayed. I felt embarrassed--I had worked hard to find a place where our stay would be pleasant. My mother was also embarrassed--she went a week without a shower and thought the manager didn't want us because she was disabled. I was so angry I later wrote a long letter of complaint to the manager of public relations for the hotel chain. I stated my feeling that errors do happen (good people make mistakes), but in such situations it is appropriate to take responsibility and do what can be done to make your guests feel at home, rather than treating them like something the cat dragged in. The response? A one-sentence "sorry there was a problem with your reservation" from the management. Hands down, the worst travel experience ever. That includes the pit toilets in China.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful shelter from a storm”
Reviews.Author: schippk
Reviews.Content: In early December of 2006 I booked a room at the Silver Cloud Inn, based on TripAdvisor reviews. We live in the Seattle area so we seldom stay at local hotels, but my husband's office Christmas party was scheduled for December 19 at the Space Needle, and we did not want to bother taking the ferry back home after the party. On the night of December 14, a massive windstorm tore through the region, toppling thousands of Douglas firs into power lines and leaving over a million people without electricity. By the morning of the 19th, we were exhausted from listening all night to our neighbors' clattering generator. My breath condensed in the 47-degree air inside our home as I packed my high heels and little black dress into a suitcase while my husband held the flashlight. "At this point," I said, pulling the hood up on my parka, "I don't care what the hotel is like as long as it has light and heat." We arrived to find a fairly nondescript midrise building tucked in among the office parks that line the technology corridor on the east side of Lake Union. As advertised, the hotel had free parking in a covered garage secured by an electronic gate. One of the reasons we had chosen this hotel was its free shuttle service to various Seattle attractions, including the Space Needle. The desk clerk told us the van departed every half hour, so we made reservations for 6:30 to get to the party by 7:00. The other clerk was continually fielding phone calls that were clearly from local people looking to escape their dark, frigid homes. I was pleased that the hotel had honored a request for a room on a high floor. We had to negotiate a confusing warren of poorly marked corridors to find our way from the elevators to our room, but everything was spotless, fairly new, and quiet. The room itself was a wonderful surprise. I had deliberately avoided booking a view room because I had not wanted to spend the extra money, but nevertheless our window overlooked part of Lake Union. Strangely, there was a second window that looked directly across a small recess in the building into a nearby (occupied) room a few feet away. We quickly pulled the curtain on that view. Our room was small but not uncomfortably so for two adults. There was a desk with high-speed Internet access, two overstuffed chairs, a coffee maker and and iron and ironing board, which we immediately put to use after packing in the dark. The bed was firm with lots of pillows and beautiful high-end linens. The bathroom was large and new and immaculate if not the last word in luxury. Best of all though, was the gas fireplace, which we immediately turned on to rid ourselves of the last remnants of hypothermia. We showed up in the lobby at the appointed hour to catch the shuttle, and found ourselves waiting along with a large family who were all dressed to the nines. I overheard them grumbling that they were still waiting for the 6:00 shuttle and had restaurant reservations that they were concerned about missing. Finally the patriarch went to the desk clerk and asked her to call the restaurant to say they would be delayed. The clerk did so, ignoring a teenaged member of the family's shouts to "tell them why we're late!" Next to her, the other clerk was answering phone calls every 15 seconds, endlessly repeating, "I'm sorry, we're fully booked. No, I don't know of any other hotels in the area that have rooms available." Finally, at 6:45, the shuttle van showed up and we all piled in, but moments later the driver came around and asked everyone who wasn't going to the restaurant to please leave so they could take the family directly there. Another van showed up about five minutes later and took us to the Space Needle. After the party, my husband called the number on the card the van driver had given us. We stood shivering outside the Needle for about twenty minutes and saw no one, so we called again. It turned out that the driver had gone to a different entrance than the one at which we had been dropped off, and had been waiting for us the entire time. He came around to our side in a few minutes and brought us back to the hotel. The next morning we found a free Sunday newspaper outside our room door. After a couple of cups of coffee by the fire, we headed down to the hotel's breakfast room. Again, signage to the area was confusing, but we followed the smell of coffee and pancakes. Inside the breakfast room was an amazing scene: Dozens of families with children of all ages were crowded around the pastry trays, coffee urns and fruit bowls. Kids in pajamas and bunny slippers were making pancakes in the automated machine while their parents lounged in the easy chairs and watched football on the TVs. In the attached solarium overlooking Lake Union, the grandparents were drinking coffee and orange juice and reading the Sunday paper. It was obvious that the storm had turned what is basically a business hotel into a family room for local refugees. The hotel staff, though clearly overwhelmed during what is usually low season, handled all of it with aplomb, keeping the coffee flowing and the cereal bins filled. We obviously did not experience the Silver Cloud Inn under anything like normal circumstances, but we were impressed with its excellent value and the grace with which the staff handled the unexpected onslaught of storm-weary guests. I would definitely recommend it to the business travelers for whom it is clearly intended. As other reviewers have noted, it is not within easy walking distance to the usual Seattle tourist attractions like the waterfront and Pike Place Market, and the shuttle van service still has a few kinks to work out, but it is clean, quiet (we had absolutely no idea it was jammed with kids until we went to the breakfast room) and an excellent value in an expensive city. The next time we are attending a late event in the city or there is a scary weather forecast, we are heading for the Silver Cloud!

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud Inn at Lake Union: Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: LynnSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn at Lake Union from 4/14/06-4/19/06 and loved it. Centrally located and easy freeway access. The front desk was friendly and pleasant. The continental breakfast was standard. Really enjoyed our room with a view of the lake. It was clean, roomy, and had very nice bedding. The rooms were quiet. Our teenager loved the pullout bed in the living room where he had his own TV and fireplace. Although we had a rental car, we used the hotel's shuttle service extensively to go to the Seattle Aquarium, the Space Needle for brunch, and to Pikes Market. It was convenient not having to pay for parking. We tipped the driver a buck per person. A nice sushi restaurant is across the street (called I Love Sushi). Down one block from the hotel, we rented a seaplane ride which we highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: KGB_4
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights in late October. We booked it based on the reviews on this site and knew that it wasn't right in town (which is a huge bonus) - but we like to walk because we feel it's the best way to get the feel of a town. First up - the location is absoultely perfect! There are plenty of places to eat and drink near by - our pick is the Blu Water Grill across the road (say hello to Pat from the Aussies and see if they still have my drink coaster on their wall of fame). A bit futher along are heaps of other restaurants. For breakfast, if you don't wish to do the free breakfast, go the other direction and visit the Grand Central Cafe and Bakery on Eastlake Ave for great coffee and fresh bread (and also visit the other places and shops around Eastlake). The hotel itself was very clean, quiet and comfortable. There is a great business centre for free interent, a little store for snacks and drinks, and plenty of fresh towels every day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was huge and had everything you need. The walk to the Space Needle or the centre of town is 20-30 mins which isn't bad - but there is the free shuttle and though we didn't use it - it was always arriving or leaving for the other guests so I imagine it would be great. A must do is to go across the road to the Seaplane flights and take a ride (with Jim) over Lake Union, Lake Washington and around Seattle - absolutely fantastic! We would definately stay here if we get back to Seattle! One last thing - find the 'troll' under Hwy 99...

Reviews.Title: “Nice shuttle service.”
Reviews.Author: saribeyaz
Reviews.Content: DISTANCE We were in seattle for a conference. The hotel is close to the convention center, it took me 15 minutes to walk there. convention center is 10 minutes far from the market place (walking distance)..so distance is not a big issue. Shuttle service of the hotel was nice, the drivers were very helpful, all we needed to do was to "call and let them know where we were" they came and picked up us. We prefered using the shuttle while going back to the hotel. The shuttle was available between 7am-10pm. The hotel is 20 minutes far from the space needle (by taxi) at night traffic, so you pay around 12$. Also, the hotel is very close (4-5minutes walking) to QFC supermarket (fresh food, bakery, drinks...) and close to the other nice little restaurants, like mediterranian food.. BREAKFAST ok, nothing very special in terms of food - there is tea and coffee service at the lobby almost all day.... nice atmosphere. but again nothing special in terms of food. ROOMS very very clean! I really liked it! the bathroom, the beds.. everything was very clean. the pillows and the bed were very comfortable..it was a tiring trip but I had a very good rest! The room has fridge, microwave, cafemachine, and a sink- COMPUTER nice internet connection - printer available - but you cannot make change in a word document/powerpoint document on those computers.. they are for very simple uses..

Reviews.Title: “Don’t even think about staying here unless you have a car.”
Reviews.Author: MK-Dublin
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews about this hotel I booked it straight away for a weekend stay in Seattle. I was really expecting something wonderful but really the hotel is just ok. It’s nothing special. Breakfast is waffles, bagels, bread and cereal - nothing to get particularly excited about there. The free coffee is handy enough but really who gets that bothered about spending a couple of dollars on coffee during their holidays. As we discovered Seattle is not one of those cities that is nice to walk around. The hotel actually looks quite near to the Space Needle but when we tried to walk there the route really looks like some sort of demilitarised zone, with no other pedestrians, four lane highways, pavements with weeds growing out of the cracks and rundown businesses. My visions of a nice stroll to downtown Seattle sadly came to nothing. If you don’t have a car don’t stay here, stay downtown. I spent extra on an upgrade for a view of the lake but the lake is really not that stunning so it’s really not worth spending any extra on that. The shuttle is handy but it’s recommended that you book in advance and if you are downtown you have to wait for them to pick you up. As we preferred to do things on the spur of the moment we ended up getting taxis most of the time (there is a regular city bus service which runs past the hotel but I would definitely not recommend this after dark). Basically this is just a regular 3 star hotel in a not very nice location. The free internet was handy (especially when we tried to rearrange our flights to see if we could leave Seattle early). The rooms are standard 3 star rooms, absolutely nothing fancy in the way of decoration, however in our upgraded lake view room the bathroom was so small that the sink was in the bedroom and there was no wardrobe - just a space with a rail and some hangers. Reception constantly stank of disinfectant. I always spend a long time on Trip Advisor booking hotels before I go away and it’s never been wrong – until now. For the money I spent (including the taxis) I’m sure I could have found a deal in a much higher standard 4 star hotel downtown.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: bengalz
Reviews.Content: Well here it goes....my first review ever! My wife, son and I stayed over the weekend and we were all very pleased. As mentioned in other reviews, the free breakfast, parking and shuttle service add great value to what is already a reasonably priced hotel. We booked online the day of our stay and got an unbelievable deal. When we arrived the assistant manager upgraded us to a king suite on the top floor with a view of the water. The staff were all friendly. The shuttle driver was very proffesional and courteous. The breakfast was quite bountiful for a continental. In short, no complaints. I would also like to mention the warm atmosphere at Dukes on the waterfront. The food was delicious and the service was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Good for family guests visiting Seattle”
Reviews.Author: raincityfamily
Reviews.Content: My elderly parents stayed at the Silver Cloud on a visit to Seattle to visit us. They loved the hotel. Great breakfast, great coffee available all day. Nice view from their room. Attentive staff. They loved the free shuttle and used it to go to Pike Place Market and the Seattle Center. My son used the pool and we watched a Sea Hawks game on the big TV in the lounge. Parking was easy and free for guests. We will recommend the hotel to friends and relatives visiting Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: somanyplaces
Reviews.Content: Our stay was absolutely fine - rooms were pleasant enough and very clean, breakfast buffet was typical (waffles, eggs, cereal, fruit), employees were very nice. The shuttle is a definite plus - very convenient both for trips to major areas and surprisingly quick for return trips. We had a room with a water view, but the water view is not really that great - I wouldn't make it a "must have" by any means. My only disappointment was that I love walking around neighborhoods and this hotel's location does not really lend itself to that.

Reviews.Title: “Never on a weekend!”
Reviews.Author: 234rhc
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay through Seattlesupersaver.com . They are directly affiliated with the Seattle Visitors Bureau so they were pleasant to deal with too (when I didn't get an email confirmation as it was filtered out by my spam blocker I'm guessing). I have stayed there several times and always enjoyed it. The rooms are spacious and clean. This was the first time we have stayed there on a weekend and a wedding party (not affiliated with the hotel), across the street, had music blaring as we were trying to sleep. After a call to the front desk about the noise we were advised that the music usually doesn't run that late- 11PM and they hoped it would be over soon. We were on the back side of the hotel so the noise would have a lot worse on the lake side, but I will NEVER stay there again on a weekend, so beware. Their free shuttle service to the Space Needle and the Market and all around downtown is extremely convenient and well run. And I forgot to mention the free and secure parking was great.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: ninjagenie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel while on our honeymoon which was a road trip. I booked 2 nights at this hotel based on the reviews on here, and it seemed like a good value. We arrived and had no problem checking in and found our room to be quite spacious. We had french doors that opened out on to the road, but it was frustrating that there were no privacy shades. It was pretty much either have the curtains open or closed. Since we were on the 4th floor, people could see in from across the street, so a little privacy, as opposed to no sunlight, would have been nice. There are 2 elevator areas, but the 1 elevator by our room was really slow. You could spend 2 or 3 minutes waiting, which for a building with only 7 floors was irritating. The shuttle was okay, we went to the market, and then walked to the EMP and the Space Needle. The first night we were unsure how far away we were, but it only took us about a half hour to walk, and being that it was nice out, it wasn't a problem. We took advantage of the free laundry machines, but there was only 1 washer and 1 dryer for each floor. I ran from floor to floor checking for an open machine, which was annoying. I think next time I'd just pay to have it done by dropping it at the front desk. There is wireless on the 3rd floor lounge area only, and if you want to connect in the room, you have to have your own cable. Since I'm used to wireless, I had to buy a cable in the gift shop for $5. Just was a little annoying as every hotel we've stayed at on this trip (even Days Inns, etc) has had free in-room wireless. Restaurants across the street are great, and we LOVED I love sushi and BluWater Bistro. Stix is also fun for drinks and billiards. I guess I was a little disappointed in the nitpicky details, but overall it was a good hotel for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: lablovers
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here at the end of our week long visit to Washington. Great value! The staff was helpful and attentive. We had a room with a view of Lake Union (beautiful) and found some great resturants nearby. Even though this hotel is not in the hub area of downtown Seattle, they have a shuttle that took us anywhere we wanted to go! Also they'll pick you up whenever you'd like. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: RRSAMIC
Reviews.Content: My family stayed 2 nights at the Silver Cloud Inn in July and it was very nice! The shuttle bus was the best part of the stay. They will take you to the key tourist sites in Seattle. They even took us to the ferry dock for the boat to Victoria! The hotel is also walkable to some nice restaurants such as Dukes Chowder House. Breakfast was also very comfortable with nice picture windows of Lake Union. We would definetly stay here on our next stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Overall quite good!”
Reviews.Author: mcmousee
Reviews.Content: The Upsides: The staff were very helpful. How great that they slipped a note under every door alerting guests to the terror plot uncovered in the night and advised us of changes in airport security policies. This enabled so many guests to make their planes. The free shuttle makes all the difference. They will drive you just about anywhere and then pick you up! So our car stayed put in the free parking lot! We walked across the street and had a large choice of restaurants (avoid the sushi place). The refrigerator enabled us to shop at Pike Place market and bring home goodies for a picnic in our room. The room was good and the bed was very good. The downsides: Though the hotel is right on Lake Union it is across a major high speed road, lots of congestion and busy activity. Not a neighborhoody kind of area. Also the breakfast is an extensive buffet of wheat and fat. Not a single thing a healthy eater would have, well maybe the hardboiled egg. Have breakfast at Pike Place market.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mummabear
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Silver Cloud after a tour of the northwest and it was a lovely place to end a fantastic holiday. We had a beautifully furnished bedroom with two queen beds which were really comfortable. Our room was on the 7th floor and had a great view of the lake - it was wonderful to wake up in the mornings seeing all the seaplanes take off. The room was immaculate, as is the whole hotel. We used the outdoor pool after a day of sightseeing which was really useful. The hotel has a shuttle which takes you downtown - they even took us to see a baseball game! - so efficiently run and so useful. They offer a good complimentaty continental breakfast and free coffee in reception and all the staff are very friendly and efficient. The hotel is in a great location with restaurants withing walking distance - try Dukes Chowder House - great place with great food. Would definitely stay here again if ever in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: bubbles1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights to see the sights of Seattle with our two children. This is a good hotel for a good price. We did encounter some difficulties with our air conditioner, but it was resolved quickly. The shuttle is very helpful to get around. We felt there were plenty of restaurants within walking distance - also an Outback and Bonefish Grill. The room itself was very comfortable and clean, the bedding was wonderful and the staff very helpful. Overall this is a great hotel and one that I would stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Silver Cloud”
Reviews.Author: StJoeBeach
Reviews.Content: Thorougly enjoyed our visit to the Silver Cloud-Lake Union. Excellent location across from Lake Union. Loved watching the sailboats and seaplanes. Very nice rooms. Free parking. Excellent service from staff. Large complimentary breakfast and great Tuesday night reception. Staying at the Silver Cloud certainly started our trip to the Northwest off on a high point! Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderabout
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location across the street from Lake Union and close to the Seattle Center. Initially we were given a lower floor location, but on request we were moved to the top floor with an exceptional view of the lake and the Space Needle. The toilet/bath shower room was seperated from the wash sink and vanity which we found a strange layout, but there was a microwave, studio fridge and sink available and convenient. Bedding was very comfortable. Housekeeping was excellent and the room was in good repair. The staff were courteous and helpful. There was excellent soundproofing in the room, including the set of French glass doors that opened up for viewing. The complimentary continental breakfast scene was chaotic and open tables were always at a premium. Food items, including make your own waffles, were adequate. There was ample free parking available in the hotel's 2-floor garage. This is a decent value hotel, but the local taxes are nearly usury at $31/day. A few guide books claim that restaurants are across the street which is not true--it's a marina and boatyard. There's a cluster of restuarants about 3 blocks south in the direction of the Seattle Center/Space Needle.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: AppreciativeTraveler
Reviews.Content: Fabulous Stay July 19, 2006 Trip Advisor Viewer from Asheville, NC We stayed at the Silver Cloud pre-cruise to Alaska for 3 days and post-cruise for 1 day. We loved it here and will stay again when we take our next cruise from Seattle. The 3rd floor viewing room where breakfast is served is beautiful overlooking Lake Union. It is like a huge but cozy living room with an outdoor patio. Sunset on the patio was spectacular. The shuttle driver was excellent and took us to all the places we wanted to see and picked us up promptly. Staff was cheerful and helpful. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room clean and well-appointed. Free laundry on the 4th to 7th floor with Maytag washer and dryer was a plus. We used it as our luggage didn't arrive with us and we washed the clothes we had on for the next day. We booked the Silver Cloud because of the positive Trip Advisor Traveler's comments. Great place -- great stay. Much better than staying in the busy downtown and the price for Seattle is extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: pemberton2
Reviews.Content: If a hotel could be almost perfect for the price per night, this would be the one. Very clean, very comfortable and great service. A free business center (internet, printers, photocopy), free local calls, free coffee and tea, free laundry facilities on four floors (just $1.09 for the soap!) and an excellent free shuttle service just added to the value of this hotel. We were staying there over 4th July and had booked Mariners tickets - to our amazement we found that the hotel had organised a special shuttle trip for guests straight to Safeco Field and pickup afterwards! A minimarket in the lobby, fitness center open 24 hours and two pools as well. Rooms excellently maintained, very spacious and very clean. We watched the fireworks on Lake Union from our bedroom window and the hotel happily gave us an extra chair. We also found out next day that a serious fire had broken out a few blocks away that night and that the hotel put up people who had been evacuated free of charge. If we had to find anything to criticize it would be so small not to be worth mentioning - the breakfast was generous but a bit of a cramped area for so many people and there was only one main (slow!) elevator in the lobby - two others were situated in another wing, perhaps a design fault of the building. But that was it. A great hotel and well worth the #1 spot on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: PDXDon
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Silver Cloud. Our room was exceptionally clean and comfortable. Much bigger than other Seattle hotel rooms I have stayed in, too. The free parking is a huge plus. This saves you about $32/day over Seattle hotels. It seemed quite secure, but was still very easy to access. A good selection of nice, waterfront restaurants and bars are within walking distance, and the hotel offers a free shuttle to downtown. A taxi to anywhere in the city would be pretty cheap, too. Seattle Center (Space Needle, EMP). The only thing I didn't like about the hotel was that, while our room looked at the water, it was separated from Lake Union by Eastlake Drive, a busy road. Our room (on floor 7) was pretty quiet, even with the traffic and regular seaplane departures. The blackout drapes were a huge plus. I would definitely consider the Silver Cloud Lake Union next time I'm in Seattle. Its not only a good value, but a very nice place to stay and a good homebase from which to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “a Rare 'five'”
Reviews.Author: Sooz2
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Trip Advisor reviews, we stayed at the Silver Cloud for 3 nights. It was one of our favorite stops in a month long trip. It has it all ... it was quiet, comfortable, roomy, great beds, spotlessly clean, lovely lobby, free parking, free internet, free and accommodating shuttle to downtown, extra nice continental breakfast in a large, lovely room, and helpful staff ... we even paid extra for the beautiful view of Lake Union. We honestly hated to leave! We had a great meal at Duke's nearby, also Daniel's which was VERY expensive... also a great meal at Anthony's downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great little find right next to Lake Union. The rooms are extremely spacious with a fireplace, frig and microwave. The staff is more than accommodating. The fitness and pool area are also very nice. Will look for another opportunity to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... Good Location ... Well Worth it”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDan2
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud Inn - Lake Union is as good as the reviews appearing here. I planned a romantic getaway with my wife for the last weekend in March 2006. Well, when the baby sitting fell though at the last minute, we ended up going with our two kids aged 5 and 7. It wasn't the trip we had hoped for but it turned out to be a lot of fun. We had a lake view suite which included a pull-out couch, king sized bed, fridge, microwave and TV in each room. Unlike the last reviewer, I really enjoyed the view of Lake Union. The sunsets and sun rises were well worth it for me. The pool is great for families. It is bathtub warm and only 3 feet deep at the shallow end (which is pretty important if you are only four feet tall). There is also a whirl pool that was nice for a good hot soak. The breakfast buffet was very good. We all enjoyed the make-your-own waffels as well as the selection of pastries and yogurts. One of the best features for us was the free parking at the hotel and the on-demand free shuttle. Lake Union is very close to downtown. So, we were able to leave our car parked all weekend and just hop on the shuttle. They would drop you off where you wanted to go and come and pick you up when you were ready to come back. The hotel is in a nice neighbourhood. We felt very safe walking at night. Across the street there are a number of very good restaurants right on the lake. We really enjoyed Duke's Chowder house (which was recommended to us by the shuttle driver). It had a kids menu, fast & friendly service, reasonable prices and good food. The noise level was pretty robust which is a real plus with kids. I have to say that I think I have found my hotel of choice in the Silver Cloud Inn - Lake Union.

Reviews.Title: “"it wont dissapoint!"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on the recommendation of others on trip advisor. We were very cautious because we were taking our two year old daughter and wanted to ensure that it was suitable. Well, it didnt let us down. We stayed in a 1 bedroom lake view suit. It was clean, modern and spacious enough. We were suprised by the 42" flat screen tv on the wall when we opened the door!.
