There was some road noise at night, not from the main road directly below, but from the free-way behind, but this didnt spoil our much needed sleep. The pool was fine, clean and towels were available in the pool area. Like others before, i agree that the lift took ages to arrive at times, which was mildly frustrating!. The courtesy bus was excellent and always available. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem just outside of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Dragon
Reviews.Content: Let me echo all the wonderful reviews of the Silver Cloud Lake Union. First of all, it is all of maybe a mile or two from downtown. Given that they have a FREE shuttle to take you anywhere downtown or vicinity you might want to go - that's really no issue at all. Plus being outside of the downtown grid makes it more peaceful, more quiet, and much less expensive. The room was comfortable and large for this type of small hotel. The indoor pool, while I did not indulge, seemed very nice and is open 24 hours a day. There is also a free continental breakfast with, along with the usual stuff, make-your-own waffles, hard boiled eggs, and cheese. It's held in the third floor "view" lobby with a lovely view of the marina and lake. The "lake view" room is nice, but you are on the opposite side of the street from the lake. So it's not like looking out right over the water. It's over the street, and the marina, then the water. So, in my opinion, it's not really worth the extra price. The staff was uniformly excellent and helpful. The lobby is lovely with very interesting coffee table books on various places. I'd say the only "complaint" I had was the one main elevator was very slow. I often had to wait for a few minutes. Although, it's only 7 stories high so I did take the steps a couple of times. There is another set of elevators somewhere, but I didn't take the time to find them. If you are flying into Seattle, don't take the shuttle service offered at the airport. It was like $28 and stopped at a number of hotels. The hotel offers a town car for $35. For an extra 7 bucks I prefer the private service. Anyway - stay here when in Seattle and save $$ compared to a downtown hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Silver Cloud's Shinto Effect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night and thought this place was lovely. It has a clean modern aesthetic -almost Japanese in style - that produces a soothing effect not unlike a spa. The room was spacious, light and airy, with full amenities. We really enjoyed our stay as brief as it was. We also stayed at The Sorrento which was wonderful as well - although on the completely opposite end of the style spectrum. I probably prefer the old world style of Sorrento, but Silver Cloud is a beautiful hotel with a lot to recommend it. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: August 05 - We spent a week at this family-friendly hotel during our first trip to the Pacific Northwest. We found the room was clean, staff very helpful & friendly, and the breakfast buffet was good and had enough variety for the week. We tried to eat out on the balcony as often as possible. We arrived on a Tuesday, to a lounge happy hour, where my husband was happy to sample local beers, and my almost 2 yr old son happy to nosh on fresh fruit, cheese & crackers. The outdoor pool was usually busy, but very nice. With the price of gas so high, we used the courtesy shuttle several times, and even arranged for it to pick us up downtown several times. The waterside room was definitely worth the extra $10 for the entertainment of watching the float planes plus the sunsets. Quick walk to several good restaurants, and even a small playscape for the little one to run around. Guest computers to check email also very much appreciated. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marriedinhawaii-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Silver Cloud Inn-Lake Union for two nights. Our room was very comfortable and very clean, and we enjoyed its fireplace. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful, recommending driving routes and restaurants. We enjoyed the breakfasts in the third-floor breakfast room. The hotel is within walking distance of several good restaurants. We chose this hotel because we stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn, Tacoma, WA, two years ago, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We will stay at this and other Silver Cloud Inns in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: VisitorTraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked my mom here for two nights non consecutively. The first night she had a regular room which was just fine, nice bed, very safe. And the shuttle, what a wonderful extra. It picked her up at the train station and then took her back in the morning. She liked the free breakfast and the $99 cost - which is a good price for a clean, safe hotel (which this is) in Seattle. On the return, the shuttle picked her up at 10 pm (it runs til 11pm), and when we got there they had upgraded her (at no charge) to a Jacuzzi room, with a fireplace. She was in heaven! Very very nice room, nice staff, very clean hotel, lots of extras for the price. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to come to town and see a few sights - the free shuttle is such a great extra. Staff is pretty nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and People”
Reviews.Author: kBloke
Reviews.Content: Great location, near the City but not too close! Well situated close to I5 for trips out and about if you want a base. Almost everything is complimentary. The breakfast buffet is great although it closes at 9.30 (we'd have liked it to be 10.30!) The courtesy bus service is really good, when we stayed it was almost like having your own taxi service. Rooms are clean, well appointed and large enough. Staff are more than helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. As a side issue, I didn’t feel comfortable in the City at night (I have felt safer in New York). Nothing happened, it was just a feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Starting Point”
Reviews.Author: fishfolk
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Seattle for a 2 week long tour of Northwest Washington and our first stop was the Silver Cloud Inn on Lake Union. It was very easy to find, the location was beautiful, there were lots of good restaurants within easy walking/driving distance. You could see the Space Needle from the room and watch seaplanes taking off along with all of the water traffic on Lake Union. The breakfast buffet was pretty amazing - make-your-own waffles, pastries, cereals, granola, fruit, juices and coffee ... a great start for busy days. The hotel also offered a shuttle which began running early (7:00 am on weekdays, 9:00 am on weekends) so that you could get a start on sightseeing. We picked this spot based on previous TripAdvisor reviews and were very pleased with the choice.

Reviews.Title: “A teriffic hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: martini007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Cloud twice during the summer of 2005 while attending several Mariners baseball games. The rooms are clean and modern. Nicely furnished and a wonderful view of Lake Union if you request. Interesting to watch the seaplanes land and take off. The shuttle to Safeco Field and other places in Seattle is a nice feature as well as the comp breakfast and indoor and outdoor pools. Service is professional and frendly. High speed Internet in the rooms, ample secured parking and internet access on their computers of you don't travel with a lap top. Good access to quality resturants, jogging and walking paths and bus transportation. Best prices were on line at their web site and a suite with a Lake Union view is well worth the few extra $$. We will return for games in 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a number of days at the Silver Cloud-Lake Union in Seattle Washington and were both pleasantly surprised. Both of us are seasoned travelers and chose the Silver Cloud because of it's price and locale. We were very surprised at the overal quality of our experience. The rooms were spacious, well appointed and very clean. Granite countertops, a nice desk with free internet service, a small lounging area with sofa and table. The bathroom was contemporary, albeit a bit small, but very clean and modern. The free breakfast offered hot waffles, fruit assortment, good coffee, cerial, toast, juice and pastries. It was always a bit crowded but not to the point of being uncomfortable. This is a very nice option for families with children. There's an indoor pool and a flexible shuttle service to anywhere in town, also a very nice option for the cost concious. This is not the Four Seasons folks but, if you're looking for a nice, clean place to stay in Seattle that's very reasonable, the Silver Cloud-Lake Union is a great option. It's also very close to freeway access as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot to End a Long Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the last two nights of a long west coast trip! The front desk staff was awesome, the shuttle drivers were very helpful (including the white knuckle drives).. The inside pool is closed for the rest of the week, but we had sunny weather, and the outdoor pool was great! The breakfast was excellent with a continental + make your own waffles. Check with the staff, but the fist night we were there also had a comp. wine/beer social. When we go back to Seatte a definite must! Also, book online and you save $$

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: JoyceinNY
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 1 nite...the last nite of a 13 day trip that encompassed an alaskan cruise and 3 different hotel stays and this was our favorite hotel. Beautiful location overlooking lake union.. watch the boats and seaplanes take off...hint ...pay the $10 extra for the lakefront room and request a sleeper sofa/loveseat, I believe those rooms may be a bit larger. Anyway, hotel and rooms very clean. nice lobby, nice indoor and outdoor pools. Great free bkfst. The hotel isn't near anything so they have a great free shuttle ( tip the driver) that does drop offs and pick ups every half hour. Free internet...2 computers. Exercise room had ex bike, treadmill and epiliptical machine. would stay here again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: pouillyfume1952
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews previous to mine for all the details of the amenities/service/rooms at the Silver Cloud. We stayed from August 8th to the 11th and were very impressed with the location on Lake Union, the size and quality of the rooms, the hotel shuttle (which would take us anywhere downtown if we asked, not just the usual dropping off points), the friendly service, bountiful complimentary breakfast, and free hotel parking. We were a family of 5 -- 2 adults and 3 teenaged boys -- so we had two rooms -- a suite and a double with 2 queen beds. They didn't connect, but they were adjoining. The shuttle runs until 11pm, which was great for our 19-year old who wanted to go off on his own in the evening. Across the street were several restaurants that worked for families: Joeys, which used to be Cucina Cucina, is an upscale restaurant with a Houston's kind of menu -- seafood/asian noodles/burgers -- with an outdoor deck and gorgeous views of Lake Union and Queen Anne's hill. Blue Water Bistro, a bit closer to the hotel, has a similar menu and view. Decent wine lists at both. Very pleasant for dinner to watch the sun go down and the lights on Queen Anne's come on. The Silver Cloud is a great place for families. However, don't expect to walk to the downtown area (such as Pike Place Market or the Space Needle). It's at least a mile across some busy streets and not very interesting neighborhoods. Take the shuttle. When it's time to head back, call the shuttle to pick you up. We never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a pick up. Twice, the shuttle was already where we were. Tip the drivers. Here's a sightseeing tip. Take the commuter ferry (at Pier 55) over to Elliott Bay in West Seattle. It's $3.00 to cross and you get a great view of the waterfront. The halibut and chips at the little fish and chips place at the dock were surprisingly good and cheap. You can take a free minibus shuttle to Alki beach. It's an easy and pleasant way to ramble around a very mellow neighborhood in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel - Good View - Outstanding Value!!”
Reviews.Author: chheal
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure that I think that this place rates five stars as seems to be most people's opinion on this site. The staff was not rude, but they hardly went out of their way to help either. We got bad directions to downtown from a disinterested desk person. Other times, we got friendly service, but at the terms of the hotel, not five star going out of the way to please kind of stuff. There is a lot good at the Silver Cloud Lake Union. The shuttle service to downtown is good and on schedule. The breakfast was good, if crowded. The room was very clean and quiet. The bed was comfortable. The view was very nice. The free parking was plentiful. The location was very good. The walk to downtown is quite reasonable if you know the way. We would most definitely stay again. The Silver Cloud is not a five star place, but it is a very good very clean above average place with super rates for what you get. As far as value in hotels goes, I'm not sure that you can do any better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views for Good Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great find! Located RIGHT on Lake Union with beautiful views of the Lake. About a mile from most of the tourist attractions, but they have a free shuttle that will take you almost anywhere (even to the supermarket). Free overnight parking, too. Even if you have a car, leave it here and take the shuttle. Downtown parking is a rip. The shuttle guys live off tips. so be sure to remember. The hotel is clean, quiet, has a great outdoor pool (indoor pool was STIFLING-99 degree in the indoor area). The one drawback is that there is no restaurant or coffee shop, and there is very little in the way of nearby breakfast spots. DO NOT let the shuttle driver take you to the rip-off "13 Coins" for b-fast ($42 for bfast for my son and me). Hotel provides a basic conintental bfast, but not enough for a full day of sightseeing. If you have a car, try 14 Carrot Cafe in Eastlake. No connecting rooms, may be an issue for those of you with kids. Also, there are no bellboys, so you have to get a cart and take your luggage to your room alone. Other than that, this hotel is great. Big rooms, quiet, FREE laundry on the floor, and great views.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Silver Cloud Lake Union was wonderful. We had a room with a view of the beautiful lake with boats cruising, and sea planes taking off and landing. We could also see the Space Needle from our window. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. There is a complimentary shuttle that drops you off or picks you up anywhere in the downtown area, so we didn't even need to rent a car. I would definately stay at the Silver Cloud Lake Union again, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just as advertised!”
Reviews.Author: MarkIndiana
Reviews.Content: The Silver Cloud Inn-Lake Union-Seattle is a spotless, comfortable hotel with pleasant, hard-working staff members. Our room was plenty big for 2 people (2 queen beds). Everything appeared to be almost new. The serve-yourself breakfast had a lot of choices. My friend enjoyed both pools (indoor and out). The shuttle service is GREAT! Our driver dropped us off right across the street from our destination (Pike Place Market), and was wating for us less than 5 minutes after we made our call to be picked up for a return trip to the hotel! Free parking is a HUGE plus...you will find this out if you've never visited Seattle before. I cannot think of one thing negative about The Silver Cloud, and I'm usually pretty fussy. I was happy I depended upon the people who had reviewed this hotel, and counted on their opinions to help me select this place. I would definitely return! The hotel is close enough to downtown without quite the hustle and bustle...nice location near the waterfront and great restaurants/lounges. Hats off to Silver Cloud!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded high expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Silver Cloud Inn Lake Union for two nights at the end of June. I had selected a hotel downtown but she thought she could do better by calling the Silver Cloud Inn, where she'd stayed while on a business trip. Boy am I glad she did! She reserved a no-view room with a king bed for a low AAA rate and when we got there, we asked about and were offered a top floor "view" room (with two queen beds) for only $9.00 more. The view of Lake Union and the Seattle skyline was fabulous as the sun set. The room was very clean, even satisfying my wife for whom anything less than VERY clean would be a deal-breaker. The free "non-hot" breakfast (but with make-your-own waffles) was good and had too much variety to be simply called a "continental breakfast". Didn't use the free shuttle into downtown center, as we enjoy walking for exercise wherever we go. THe staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. The complimentary box of (many!) trufffles was a very nice touch. I'll admit I don't travel much but I sure think this place deserves its high ranking.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - no negatives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Seattle and the Silver Cloud Lake Union did not disappoint. Great views of Lake Union, very convenient location, great continential breakfast (very complete offerings including make-your-own waffles and the delicious Tully's coffee). The hotel was clean and quiet, even on the 4th of July weekend. We had a regular room with a king-sized bed. The room was sizable (plenty of room for suitcases, etc) and had a microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, sink, ironing board, and TV with cable. There is free parking at the hotel, which seems to be somewhat rare in nearby hotels. The staff was very helpful, and there is a small "store" with some food items and toiletries in the lobby that's open 24 hours. This came in handy since we arrived at 3am and were very hungry! The hotel is very easy to find and is convenient to I-5. The one possible downside is that there is no grocery store (or even a convenience store) nearby. This is a bit surprising since it is not the only hotel in the area. It is great to have a microwave and refrigerator, but you might want to consider stocking up on snacks before you arrive. We would definitely stay in this hotel again the next time we are in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, definitely overated on this website”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this small hotel from June 12-17. At best it is ok, the hotel is clean but the staff does not go out of their way to accomodate their guests as described in the other reviews. The first morning of our stay we went down for breakfast at about 830am and found that most of the food was gone, but they did have make your own waffles, and they were very good. I was somewhat disappointed because I had some pretty high expectations, especially since it is ranked #5 on this sites list. They advertise free guest laundry, but they don't tell you that they only have one washer and dryer per floor and they are only located on floors 4 to 7. Every time we wanted to use them they were already in use. The shuttle service they offer leaves the hotel every 1/2 hr and they tell you they only have certain drop off and pick up points. They don't tell you that they will actually drop and pick you up anywhere within the main part of the city, you have to ask. I would not stay here again. It was just OK...Next time I want to try something GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Great Staff, Service and Views”
Reviews.Author: VisitorFromTexas
Reviews.Content: We spent Saturday night on Memorial Day weekend and returned the following Wednesday night. This hotel has it all. A convenient location (less than a mile north of the Space Needle), clean, decent sized rooms, a great view of Lake Union and the Space Needle (it's worth the extra money for a view room - as long as you are on the fifth floor or higher), free breakfast (go early on weekends), free parking (warning-the spaces are small), and a free shuttle (runs from 7am-11pm on weekdays and 9am-11pm on weekends). On our first night, everything was perfect. When we checked in on our second night, our "non-smoking" room (437) smelled of fresh cigarette smoke - surprising, since this hotel is supposed to be 100% non-smoking. Obviously, not all guests adhere to this rule. The clerk at the front desk was apologetic and immediately gave us a different smoke-free room (411). The room was fine. The view was not quite as good as our previous room (611), since the roofs of the boatyards across the street, partially blocked the view of the lake. The free shuttle is a big plus (note-the driver accepts tips - we tipped a $1/rider, quite a bargain). They advertise they go to the Space Needle, Westlake Center, Pike Place Market, Waterfront and Pioneer Square. Each time we called the desk, they were ready to leave within 15 minutes. We called them from the McDonalds across the street from the Space Needle and they beat us to the pickup point at the front door of the Needle. In addition to the regular stops, the driver offered to take us to any of the local restaurants for dinner and even gave us coupons for free appetizers at Rock Fish. On future trips to Seattle, this will be our hotel.
